101001.name: "Oosehe"?
101001.description:
A card game featuring lovely images of animals.Each player chooses a different animal, from the 8 listed on the Key Card.
Cards are dealt out and kept by each player in a face-down stack. In his turn, a player must turn over the top card. If it matches any other face-up card, both players with the now matching cards must call "Oosehe"?, and name the animal now revealed. The first to do so, claims the matching cards plus all the cards beneath it.
The rules are a little strange in that you are asked to call the name as listed on the Key Card but as this name is also on the cards, players could just read the card itself. Maybe Victorian children found these animals exotic and not instantly recognisable.
The name of the game is pronounced "Oose he?", as rhyming with the phrase "Whose He?"

101002.name: Sefite
101002.description:
A rare card game for the late Victorian era. For once, it is not a Snap, Happy Families or Old Maid variant.
The cards have a fair amount of text on them (see images), not just the naval illustration. I am assuming that cards are revealed and interaction takes place between the different kinds of vessels now on view. The Battleship can protect 'Simple cards' drawn against a Destroyer. The Cruiser is a 'Simple card' itself and needs the protection of the Battleship. And other ships have their 'rules', the Destroyer, the Merchantman and the Torpedo Boat. A Victorian boy must have been thrilled with this game, with its military links.
By the way, the odd title is intended to be pronounced 'Sea-Fight'.

101003.name: Dora the Explorer: Animal Adventures
101003.description:
User Summary

Kids game where Dora the Explorer, Boots and her friends travels to the rain forest. Several small minigames, with educational value, woven into one story.

101004.name: The Legion of Shadow
101004.description:
From the Back of the Book:

You have no memory of your past...

With only a sword and a backpack to your name, you must discover your destiny in an unfamiliar world full of monsters and magic.

As you guide your hero through this epic adventure, you will be choosing the danger that they face, the monsters that they fight and the treasures that they find. Every decision that you make will have an impact on the story - and, ultimately, the fate of your hero.


From the Publisher's Website:

You are an outcast: a renegade with no memory of your past. In seeking to unlock your true identity, you find yourself on a path to redemption - to save the world from one of the greatest threats that it has ever known: the sinister Legion of Shadow.

101005.name: Wagan Land
101005.description:
The first installment of the series. It was originally released for the Family Computer on February 9, 1989, and then ported to the Game Gear on July 26, 1991. The Famicom version was re-released on the Wii Virtual Console on September 2008.

The objective of the game is to reach the end of each action scene by making the best use of Wagan's sound wave attacks and jumping ability. The player must confront a boss at the end of certain stages, but instead of actually fighting the boss in battle, the player is challenged to a mini-game where they must score more points than their opponent. The graphics in this installment featured simple backgrounds with bright colors. The boss theme that was later used in Wagan Land 2 and Super Wagan Land was first used in this installment for the shiritori and concentration mini-games.

The Game Gear version of the Wagan Land is different from the Famicom version and the plot involves Wagan Land being attacked by Dr. Devil once again. In order to avoid the afterimage effect that was caused by playing action games on an LCD game at the time of the game's release, some of the stages were redesigned and others were replaced. New power-up items for the action scenes were also added that were previously introduced in Wagan Land 2 (which was released prior to the Game Gear version), as well as an hourglass that stops time during the mini-game segments. The Game Gear version lacks the ability of allowing the player to slowly descend into the ground by pressing the jump button while in mid-air, a features that has been included in the other games of the series.

Source: Wikipedia, "Wagan Land", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101006.name: Kanshaku tamanage Kantarō no Tōkaidō Gojūsan-tsugi
101006.description:
Tōkaidō Gojūsan-tsugi (東海道五十三次 53 Stations of the Tōkaidō?) is a side-scrolling action-adventure game developed and published by Sunsoft. The game's full title is Kanshaku tamanage Kantarō no Tōkaidō Gojūsan-tsugi (かんしゃく玉投げカン太郎の東海道五十三次 Firework Thrower Kantaro's 53 Stations of the Tōkaidō?). The game was released in Japan on July 3, 1986 for the Family Computer (Nintendo Entertainment System), and has been re-released for several other platforms in video game compilations.

The first re-release was made on June 29, 2001 for the Microsoft Windows operating system as part of the Ultra 2000 Sunsoft Classic Games 2 compilation. The game was also coupled with Ikki, and its value version release, YuYu Sunsoft Kessaku-shu 2 (released July 2, 2004), and Memorial Series Sunsoft Vol.3 for the PlayStation (released December 27, 2001) which also included The Wing of Madoola, another Sunsoft game. Tōkaidō Gojūsan-tsugi was ported into a java application for mobile phones under the NTT DoCoMo operator in September 2003. On October 14, 2008, it was released for the Wii's Virtual Console only in Japan

Source: Wikipedia, "Tōkaidō Gojūsan-tsugi (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101007.description:
"FQ3" is a board game that recreates the world of the car races. With a mixture of strategy, action, control of risk, and some touches of role, FQ3 represents a real way (and funny too), all that happens inside and outside of the tracks.

"FQ3" has 3 difficulty levels of rules to satisfy all kind of players;

- BASIC RULES: Aimed at casual and undemanding gamers.

- ADVANCED RULES: For fans of race games. These rules are more realistic, and involved all sorts of factors: such as types of tires, fuel loads, setting the car, kers, yellow flag, Safety Car, moral of drivers and injuries, etc.

- MANAGER MODE: Only for those who drink gasoline! In this game mode, in addition to the role of pilot, you will assume the role of team manager. You will manage the economy, hiring drivers, sponsors, engineers, desing the car and evolve it. The years pass and drivers will gain experience and they will improve their skills.

SUMMARY OF GAMEPLAY: The Friday of the GP, the player must decide the strategy (number of stops, tires, and fuel load).

On Saturday, will be held the pole position, it follows a mathematical operation involving various modifiers (skills of the pilot, car performance, fuel load, tires, moral, blunders, and a roll of 1d20).

The race takes place the Sunday.
The circuit is composed of squares. The cars will go moving by circuit as many squares as the speed (gear dependent) of your car.
When the cars reach the corners, the drivers must brake and accelerate. Brakes and accelerates with a d100. Drivers have an ability to Brake and Accelerate that used to take curves (higher or lower depending on driver).
These skills will be modified by the fuel load, tire types, and how close you decide to brake and accelerate.
The risk you take in the curves is important; you can take away your opponents, but be careful!, fail brake roll or acceleration roll will damage your car.

The game stands on four pillars:
The driver, the car, the pit stop mechanics, and the circuit.
Each of them has many different skills, qualities or details that make it different from the others.

This is a brief summary of how to play. There are many and funny rules, such as kers, spin, overtaking, blunders, drivers' virtues, drive's defects, safety car,etc.
101007.name: FQ3

101008.description:
This is a card you can add to your Aquarius deck to alter the gameplay to resemble Seven Dragons.

The front of the card is an image of the Aquarius Dragon, and the back of the card contains the instructions on how to use this card. It acts as a new starter card, and is initially wild.

As you play Actions to the discard pile, the Aquarius Dragon changes color to match the top Action card in the discard pile. You can also choose to play an Action to the discard pile without fulfilling the action in order to just change the color of the Dragon. Or you choose can play an Action card to the bottom of the discard pile to get the benefit of the action without changing the Dragon.
101008.name: Aquarius: Dragon

101009.description:
This is an Action that you can add in to your Seven Dragons deck.

When played, you gather up all players' hands, shuffle them, and deal them out among the players, starting with yourself. It has part of the rainbow dragon's image in the center, and when played to the top of the discard pile, it causes the Silver Dragon to act as a wild card.

This is the action card from the game's predecessor, Aquarius, that was left of the Seven Dragons re-implementation.
101009.name: Seven Dragons: Shuffle Hands

101010.name: Good to Firm
101010.description:
User Summary

Horse Racing Management Simulation.

Buy Horses, Hire Trainers & Jockeys, pick the fields and levels you wish to race your horses in. You can even place a side bet or two as well.

Once you've raced a horse, you can then breed it to create new horses to train and breed, building your stable, and your horse racing empire!

101011.name: Front Office Football 2007
101011.description:
Solecismic Software's Flagship Sports Management Simulation

From the Publisher's Website

The sixth installment of our signature product, Front Office Football 2007, was released on October 27, 2006. It is only available through electronic download. Please visit our web store for a link to the order page. The most recent version is 6.4, released in October 2010 with the 2010 rosters and schedule.

Front Office Football is designed to represent a snapshot of professional football as it exists under the current salary cap system. You play the role of the general manager of a team. In order to succeed in Front Office Football, you need to perform as well as possible in four different areas.

Team Performance. On the field, your primary goal is winning the coveted Front Office Bowl. Your fans, players and staff all want to see that championship banner raised to a new position in the ring of honor surrounding your stadium.

Front Office Football
Financial Performance. Off the field, your team needs to show a profit, or the owner will become angry and threaten your job. You need to control salary and staff costs while balancing the need to spend money to build and upgrade your stadium against the risk of facing stagnant ticket revenue with an aging arena.

Roster Value. You need to negotiate contracts, sign free agents, make wise decisions in the amateur draft and outsmart opposing general managers in trade. Building a strong, capable roster means everything in Front Office Football.

Franchise Value. The bottom line is that a happy owner has a franchise that's the envy of professional football. Nothing means more to the owners than seeing their franchise on the top of the list of most valuable franchises. You help put your team on that list by excelling in the three other categories, but the best general managers look for opportunities to move the team in order to find a home town with a strong economy that will support your team like none other.

Each season, Herb the Referee evaluates your performance in these four categories, and presents your grades on his chalkboard.

101012.name: Front Office Football: The College Years
101012.description:
From the Publisher Website

The College Years is the college football counterpart to Solecismic Software's award-winning Front Office Football.

In The College Years, you assume the role of the head coach of a major college football team. Each year, you'll recruit athletes from any of nearly 14,000 public high schools modeled in the game, train them and try to build a winning team in the challenging world of college football. The College Years

Long-term success in The College Years requires you to win championships, develop your school's academic reputation and build a profitable football program through alumni donations, television revenue and ticket sales.

The College Years is a text-based sports simulation aimed at fans who enjoy the numbers in sports as much as they enjoy the on-field action. The interface focuses on packing enormous amounts of data about each team and athlete into easily accessible lists and charts. The game simulation is depicted through play-by-play descriptions of the on-field action. Coaches can optionally view games through a graphical representation of a stadium scoreboard.

Coaches can simulate a full season in less than ten minutes on one of today's low-end computers. This speed is vital. The game's success centers around its depth, replay value and the ability to play literally hundreds of seasons in a career. The game is designed to run on any Windows-based operating system, '95 or later.

The College Years is the sequel to original Front Office Football, a professional football simulation originally released in 1998. It received an Editors' Choice Award from Computer Gaming World and was nominated by Computer Gaming World and several online magazines for Sports Game of the Year. EA Sports Front Office Football (Front Office Football 2) and Front Office Football 2001 were published by Electronic Arts and also received Editors' Choice Awards from Computer Gaming World.

Please visit our web store for a link to the order page.

138941.name: Ninja: Legend of the Scorpion Clan – Himeji expansion

101013.description:
A Strategy Game of Hidden Movement

The night is quiet, but somewhere in the darkness shadows are moving. A ninja and a double-crossing samurai sneak into the Lion Clan castle, intent on completing their dastardly tasks. Though alert, the Lion guards are as yet unaware that anything is amiss...

This tense standalone game pits Lion Clan samurai guards against a Scorpion Clan ninja and his traitor ally. As the ninja or the traitor, you will use hidden movement to sneak into the castle, eliminate guards, find your mission objective, and escape. As the guards, you will use your wits and superior numbers to thwart the sinister Scorpion.

In this exciting new game set in the world of Legend of the Five Rings, you must use your limited resources, powers of deduction, and a touch of guile to outthink and outmanoeuvre your opponent. Daring, planning, and a little luck will determine whether you triumph or meet your end on 3 feet of steel.

[Publisher blurb]
101013.name: Ninja: Legend of the Scorpion Clan

101014.name: Ben 10: Mission
101014.description:
Ben 10 is on an important mission, join him on his quest in this Ben 10 Mission Board Game. A fantastic adventure for 2 to 4 players aged 5 and up.

Travel around the board collecting power tokens, transforming into alien warriors and battling Ben's many enemies. The first player to collect enough power tokens and reach the finishing square wins the game!

Included:

* Game board
* 4 playing pieces
* Die
* 12 power tokens
* Instructions

101015.name: Target: Renegade
101015.description:
Target: Renegade is a scrolling beat'em up (or flip-screen on certain versions) computer game released on the Amstrad CPC, Commodore 64 and ZX Spectrum systems in the late 1980s by Ocean Software on their "Imagine" label, as well as a Nintendo Entertainment System version published by Taito. The game is a sequel to Renegade and was followed by Renegade 3. When acquiring the license to convert the original arcade game Renegade to home computers, Ocean acquired the option to produce and release their own home-computer-only sequels to the game, and Target Renegade was the first of these sequels.

The game caters for one or two players, providing a "Co-operative Mode" (it was a one-player game on the C64, though), and concerns itself with the adventures of a streetfighter known only as "Renegade", who seeks revenge against a local crime kingpin named "Mr. Big" for murdering his brother Matt. The player wears a white vest and sunglasses, apart from the Spectrum original version, where, due to technical limitations, the player wears a shaded black vest.

The cover of the game portrayed a topless street fighter, clearly well versed in martial arts, performing a flying kick through a window. In keeping with videogame box art and advertising of the era, the character shown in this illustration bears no relation to any character in the game itself. The actual picture is of Martial Arts Legend Joe Lewis from the cover of his book The World's Greatest Fighter Teaches You How To Master Bruce Lee's Fighting System but has been adjusted so as to fit in with the character of Renegade.

Clearly inspired by the success of Double Dragon - Ocean were outbid for the official license - which was in turn pre-figured by the original Renegade arcade game, this side-scrolling "beat 'em up" was recognised at the time for its playability on the ZX Spectrum format. Though a multi-load game on most formats (the game would instruct you to "press play on tape" on completion of a level) the 128k Spectrum version made use of the machine's extra memory and loaded the whole game in one go.

Version Differences
The game comprises five levels, though details of enemies / weapons vary from one version to another (the NES version in particular is more like Double Dragon than the home computer versions and is generally regarded as inferior to them). The NES and C64 versions of the game do not have a two-player co-operative mode.

Source: Wikipedia, "Target: Renegade", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101016.name: Are You Smarter Than a 5th Grader? Game Time

videogameseries.10928: Are You Smarter Than A 5th Grader?

101016.description:
User Summary

Are You Smarter Than A 5th Grader? Game Time is a trivia game based on the television show of the same name. This release is the 2nd game based on the show, and players team up with a 5th grade partner to answer a variety of quizshow questions. There are over 5000 pieces of trivia included in the game.

101017.name: LiberalOpoly
101017.description:
LiberalOpoly follows the format of Parker Brothers Monopoly.

Instead of trading properties, as is the case of Monopoly, LiberalOpoly player's trade political favors in exchange for financial support from interest groups. Instead of Chance and Community Chest cards, LiberalOpoly features "Bushwacked" and "Meet the Press" Cards, which are an especially creative aspect of the game.

The cover image for LiberalOpoly portrays John Kerry as Mr. Monopoly, with cane in hand, popping out of the "O" in LiberalOpoly. It also features an intoxicated Ted Kennedy drunk on the lawn, John Edwards chasing an ambulance, Michael Moore eating cheeseburgers and Barbara Streisand flying over the Hollywood hills on a broom

101018.name: Are You Smarter Than a 5th Grader? Make the Grade

videogameseries.10928: Are You Smarter Than A 5th Grader?

101018.description:
User Summary

Are You Smarter Than A 5th Grader? Make the Grade is a trivia game based on the TV series of the same name. Players team up with a 5th grade student to answer a variety of questions about history, science, art, and more.

101019.name: Ranger Rick-opoly
101019.description:
Ranger Rick-opoly has all the fun of a traditional property game with some wild twists.
Go hiking and be a caretaker for your favorite animals in the Deep Green Wood. Raise the rent by collecting blocks of fresh CLEAN AIR and trade them in for a big PINE TREE! Learn fun facts on each animal deed... and MAKE CAMP and join Ranger Rick and his friends on a wonderful adventure.

101020.description:
Enter Rome at the time of the slave uprisings under Spartacus! The escaped rebels have managed to gain influence and power. Rome is attempting to undermine the stronger armies of the slaves in order to restore "pax", or peace – but only for personal gain.

Will the Empire collapse under the strain, or will their promises to insurgents succeed in drawing them to their side?

The players play the part of the escaped slaves who try to increase their sphere of influence and undermine the Roman establishment. Using their cards, they expand their power in seven different categories. At the end of the game, each player tries to be stronger than Rome - and, of course, stronger than any opponent. Through intrigue, however, a player can join forces with Rome and thus contribute to its victory over the slave revolt.

PAX is a multi-faceted game of card management and influence in which each card requires a tricky tactical decision. With two copies of the game, up to eight players can compete for a foothold in the Roman Empire.
101020.name: PAX

101021.name: Alberta-opoly

647.name: Late for the Sky Production Company

101021.description:
Alberta-opoly was created with the help of Albertans.

Alberta-Opoly hits the highlights with some of the province’s most interesting landmarks. Full of buffalo, crops, and parks, this game is truly about Alberta. So choose your token and roll the dice.
You may be the new owner of Dinosaur Provincial Park or meet aliens at the province’s UFO landing pad.

101022.name: Army Men: Soldiers of Misfortune
101022.description:
The plot of Soldiers of Misfortune is a major departure from the rest of the Army Men series. No reference is made to the regular Army Men characters, or to any of the events that occurred in past games. The player assumes the role of a young boy named Timmy, who imagines himself as a toy soldier and uses weapons such as a miniature dart. This game is not officially part of the series, and is not considered canonical. The game was a failure and received largely negative reviews similar to Major Malfunction, many fans consider Soldiers of Misfortune to be the worst game in the series

Source: Wikipedia, "Army Men (series)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101023.name: Parade-opoly

647.name: Late for the Sky Production Company

101023.description:
Take part in a favorite holiday tradition with the Parade-opoly board game.

Just roll the dice and march your way through Columbus Circle and down to 34th and Broadway with all the famous floats and balloons of Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade.

101024.name: Pond Hockey-opoly
101024.description:
Pond Hockey-Opoly is a game that brings back the memories of frozen feet, runny noses, fresh air and the way hockey is meant to be played.

It has all the action of a traditional property trading game... along with some nifty stick-handling fun! Buy your favorite ponds and rinks, then collect «warm-up shacks» and trade them in for «arenas». As you play, turn over the deeds to learn interesting facts about each pond or rink.

101025.name: Army Rescue
101025.description:
User Summary

Army Rescue is an action/puzzle game for the Wii. Players need to catch their soldiers after cutting their parachute cords, requiring good timing and hand-eye coordination. Getting in the way are enemy shooters, but the player can eliminate them as they appear.

101026.name: Words With Friends
101026.description:
Words With Friends is a multi-player word-oriented mobile game developed by Zynga With Friends (formerly Newtoy, Inc.). It challenges players to take turns building words crossword puzzle style with one or more friends, or by being matched with random opponents. Its rules and points system is based on that of the popular board game, Scrabble. Up to 20 games can be played simultaneously using push notifications to alert players when it is their turn. Released July 2009 and published by Zynga, Words with Friends is available for cross-platform play on devices running the operating systems Android and iOS (iPad, iPhone, iPod Touch). In addition, there is a chat feature built in the game that allows you to chat with your opponent. The Words with Friends is one of the top ranking games in the iOS application store, available as both a free ad support and an ad-less paid version.

Source: Wikipedia, "Words With Friends", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101027.name: Around the World in 50 Games
101027.description:
User Summary

Around the World in 50 Games has the player visit five exciting locales around the world to engage in 50 interesting challenges.

101028.name: Hanging With Friends
101028.description:
User Summary

Hanging with friends is a game from Zynga(with friends) that follows their template of a 2 player game based with both hotseat play and turned based network play on mobile devices.

The game is strongly based around the classic hangman model, with a few twists. Players are give a rack of letter tiles similar to that of scrabble(words with friend) and use these letters to make up words in hangman style that their opponent then needs to solve within preset number of guesses. If the opponent fails guess the word they lose a balloon after X of fails they fall into the lava and the game is over. Players take turns both attempting to solve the word of their opponent and making words with their tiles to stump their opponents.

Another twist is that letters have a value again similar to scrabble and can gain bonuses with random score/point bonuses if they can stretch their letters/words to meet these bonus squares. The points are used or can be spent on gaining hints or getting more guesses when attempting to solve their opponents words.

101029.name: Astro Boy: The Video Game
101029.description:
Astro Boy: The Video Game is an action video game based on the 2009 CG animated film of the same name. The game was released in worldwide on October 20, 2009 to coincide with the theatrical release of the film on October 23, 2009.

Plot

In the game, players become the iconic hero, Astro Boy, and take to the streets and skies on an epic adventure to save Metro City from the clutches of the evil President Stone and his robot army.

Gameplay

Utilizing Astro’s entire arsenal of iconic weapons and abilities—Finger Lasers, Arm Cannon, Twin Machine Guns and Drill Attacks, players will battle hordes of robot enemies and colossal bosses including some never-before-seen enemies across Metro City and the remains of Soylent Green's dilapitated concept of Earth in 2022. Using an intuitive combat system that adds depth to gameplay, players will experience awesome classic platform action and exhilarating flight combat levels as they use Astro’s unique rocket boosters to hover, avoid enemies and zip out of the way of danger.

The game offers numerous unlockable and collectable elements that include exclusive art work, different versions of Astro Boy and more, as players live the story solo or side by side with a friend in 2 player co-op mode on Wii and the PlayStation 2 system.

Source: Wikipedia, "Astro Boy: The Video Game", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101030.name: Astro Boy: The Video Game (DS)
101030.description:
Astro Boy: The Video Game is an action video game based on the 2009 CG animated film of the same name. The game was released in worldwide on October 20, 2009 to coincide with the theatrical release of the film on October 23, 2009.

Plot

In the game, players become the iconic hero, Astro Boy, and take to the streets and skies on an epic adventure to save Metro City from the clutches of the evil President Stone and his robot army.

Gameplay

Utilizing Astro’s entire arsenal of iconic weapons and abilities—Finger Lasers, Arm Cannon, Twin Machine Guns and Drill Attacks, players will battle hordes of robot enemies and colossal bosses including some never-before-seen enemies across Metro City and the remains of Soylent Green's dilapitated concept of Earth in 2022. Using an intuitive combat system that adds depth to gameplay, players will experience awesome classic platform action and exhilarating flight combat levels as they use Astro’s unique rocket boosters to hover, avoid enemies and zip out of the way of danger.

The game offers numerous unlockable and collectable elements that include exclusive art work, different versions of Astro Boy and more, as players live the story solo.

Source: Wikipedia, "Astro Boy: The Video Game", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101031.name: ATV Quad Kings
101031.description:
User Summary

ATV Quad Kings is a motocross racing game for the Wii. Players can compete on their own or against a friend in four different game modes: Arcade, World Tour, Time Trial, and Freestyle.

There are a wide range of vehicles to choose from, each with unique performance traits, and winning races earns money that can be used to further customize the rides. The Wii Wheel can be used to create a realistic driving experience.

101032.name: ATV Quad Kings (DS)
101032.description:
In ATV Fever, take on the most challenging tracks in the world, and compete against the best in events, on dirt tracks, off road, and through treacherous mountains. Choose from 9 Honda ATVs to suit your racing style and the terrain. Bump riders if they get too close, use your turbo boost and jump to get clear of the “pack”, and interact with movable objects in each exotic location!

- Race in 50+ events
- Race 9 Official Honda Licensed off-road vehicles
- Solid easy-to-master game play
- Split screen multiplayer

Source: The Developer Website.

101033.name: Backyard Football 2008
101033.description:
Backyard Football 2008 (known simply as Backyard Football for the Nintendo DS and Wii) is a fifth title in the Backyard Sports series and was released on September 26, 2007 for the Wii, PlayStation 2, Nintendo DS, and PC. This is the first Backyard Football Game to be released on the Nintendo DS.

Source: Wikipedia, "Backyard Football '08", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101034.name: Backyard Football '09
101034.description:
Backyard Football is a sports game that was released on October 21, 2008. This is the eighth iteration of the Backyard Football game from the Backyard Sports series. The cover athlete is Tom Brady of the New England Patriots.

The game includes all 22 backyard kids and 15 professional players as kids. Professional players include Tom Brady, Peyton Manning, Tony Romo, LaDainian Tomlinson, Brian Urlacher, Reggie Bush, and Frank Gore and more. Along with the NFL players, most of the classic backyard kids are in the game including Pete Wheeler, Pablo Sanchez, and Ernie Steele.

Source: Wikipedia, "Backyard Football '09", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101035.name: Worms: A Space Oddity
101035.description:
User Summary

This is another in the line of Worms games, featuring the same heavy artillery wielding worms. The combat is silly and turn-based, the terrain is large and destructible, and the worms and battle conditions and options are able to be customized.

The whole game is space themed.

101036.name: Backyard Football '10
101036.description:
User Summary

Backyard Football '10 is an arcade-style football game for the Wii, PS2, and Xbox 360. Players can compete alone or with a friend in a variety of game modes.

101037.name: Bullet Boy
101037.description:
The planet is in peril! Aliens from the far reaches of space are invading, and only Bullet Boy can stop them! This action-packed shooter casts you in the role of Bullet Boy, brave defender with a home-made anti-alien blaster tank. Rip enemy alien ships apart with dual repeating cannons and revel in a constant rain of wreckage as you fight to protect your town!

Grab upgrades and blaze away with ship shattering glee through five introductory levels, collect bullet points and unlock 15 more levels of furious alien assault. Unlock Bullet Girl and disintegrate alien formations with mighty nukes. Confront the alien mother ship in a final deadly confrontation. Show the invaders this planet isn’t theirs to take!

Features

Five free levels of alien blasting carnage
Fifteen additional levels including a final boss battle in the unlocked version
Powerful weapon upgrades and mighty nukes to help tear through endless waves of invaders
Unique enemy ships with crafty and dangerous abilities to rattle your nerves and test your skill
Unlock and play as Bullet Girl
Game Center Achievements
Built for iPhone, iPod and iPad devices
Compatible with iOS 3.02+




Source: The Game Website.

101038.name: Mooniz
101038.description:
WHAT ARE THE MOONIZ?

These cute but cheeky critters are invading from the moon and you are Earth's only hope in this simple yet highly addictive action puzzle game!

Save the world from these adorable moon monsters by tapping groups of same-colored Mooniz to make them explode in a spectacular display of dazzling colors. To help you in your quest to repel these mysterious invaders there are killer power-ups available including point multipliers, first aid kits, nukes, and more!

FEATURES

Action packed, color-matching arcade puzzler
Simple, intuitive touch controls
Just tap groups of same-color mooniz to pop'em!
Classic and Rush game modes loaded with challenges
Fast paced gameplay and killer power-ups
Awesome artwork for HD Retina Display on the iPhone
Unique musical score, with an uplifting groove
Easy to learn, hard to master
Endless hours of fun for the whole family
Online leaderboards using GameCenter
Share your highscores on Facebook
Mooniz works on your iPhone and iPod Touch




Source: The Game Website.

101039.name: Par Out Golf
101039.description:
Ready for an exciting new golfing experience? Something uniquely challenging, family friendly and refreshingly uncomplicated? Then hit the links with Par Out Golf for the iPad, iPhone, and iPod Touch.

FEATURES

Unique style of game play - Draw the path of your shot!
Two stunningly illustrated 18-hole courses.
Play up to 4-players at a time on the same device, or use Game Center to go head-to-head against friends and other golfers from around the world.
Play Par Out Golf over and over again! The game is never the same twice and certainly not as easy as it sounds!
Unlock new courses and earn badges the better you play!
Use Game Center to quickly invite others to play. Be on the fairway with friends in seconds!
Family friendly! Play with your kids. Teach them the game of golf. Or, they may teach YOU a thing or two.
Earn bragging rights and crush your friends. Watch the Game Center leader-board and track scores from all over the world.
Uncomplicated. Challenging. Addicting. Social. Just like the real thing!
Based on the award-winning Par Out Golf: The Links at PenHurst board game.




Source: The Game Website.

101040.name: Zombie Shock
101040.description:
User Summary

Zombie Shock is a run-and-gun game set in a New York overrun by zombies. The game features a wide variety of zombie characters and numerous upgradeable weapons.

There are two game modes : Scenario and Survival. In Scenario, play through 50 stages to uncover the story of ZombieShock and the characters. In Survival, battle against endless zombie attacks.

101041.name: Prince Interactive
101041.description:
Prince Interactive is an interactive CD-ROM released in 1994, based on the musician Prince and his Paisley Park Studios recording complex. The disc contains a videogame, songs, music videos, a virtual tour through Paisley Park Studios and other multimedia resources.

The videogame is a graphic adventure similar to Myst, requiring the player to explore the many different rooms in Paisley Park Studios and solve puzzles to collect the five pieces of Prince’s symbol.

The CD-ROM also features six complete songs, including several which were previously unreleased, 52 song clips, four full-length music videos, 31 video clips, and nine morphs.

Source: Wikipedia, "Prince Interactive", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101042.name: The Firebrands
101042.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Flames That Burn Brightly

We are the sparks that incite change, the embers that burn down armies and the blades that cut the strings of corrupt politics. The Ninja Crusade has targeted our kind and we are not the ones to back down. The future is ours to control and will be written in the blood of our enemies.

And Burn with a Righteous Fury

Wu Xing: The Firebrands is the first clan sourcebook for Wu Xing: The Ninja Crusade. Experience the expansive territories, training methods and individual cultures of the Fire-Aspected clans: The Blazing Dancers, who live the dance of fire, and the Virtuous Body Gardeners with their fiery-tempered blades. All the secrets await within for the Izou Empire’s youngest clans.

This Book Includes:

- Learn about all facets of clan life directly from prominent Dancers and Inks
- New clan-specific Wushu, Fighting Styles and even Celestial Animals
- Two new clans that work beside the firebrands
- New Adventure included!

101043.name: RADiODDiTY
101043.description:
User Summary

An abstract action game. Use your radioactive energy to guide cells towards their colored targets. Avoid hazards such as automatic radiation points, bumpers and monstrous mutators!

Best Overall Game at the University of Portsmouth's Game Jam 2010.

101044.name: Wing Island
101044.description:
User Summary

A flight simulator in which the player flies a plane or planes to perform challenges or simply fly using the Wii remote to navigate.

The producer stated that the game was inspired by Pilotwings.

101045.name: Nightmare in Blackmarsh
101045.description:
from the back of the box

Set 2: Nightmare in Blackmarsh

What will befall your adventurers in the village of Blackmarsh? Will they become involved in a brawl in the tavern? Discover the fabled Black Pearl? Or save the village from dark powers rising from the Black Marsh?
The village is fully mapped on a large colourful play-sheet for use with 25mm miniature figures. The sheet is compatible with our Dungeon Floor Plans to allow you to adapt the village as you wish. A booklet details the village and its occupants together with adventure ideas. The full-colour game-masters' screen provides the players with a history of the area and the game-master with Encounter Tables and a keyed village plan. A colour map of the region completes the set which can be used on its own or to link with Dungeon Planner Set 1: Caverns of the Dead.

101046.name: Shape Shift
101046.description:
User Summary

A match-3 game that allows you to swap tiles from anywhere on the screen. The game features two modes of gameplay: the action packed Classic Mode, or the peaceful Zen mode. The app features an original musical score and tons of achievements to collect.

101047.name: Bakugan Battle Brawlers
101047.description:
Bakugan Battle Brawlers is a video game based on the original anime series made by NOW Production and Activision

The Bakugan battles are very different from the anime series and the general rules. At the beginning take a gate card, which will land on the field. Then you have to target an aim on the battlefield (like a gate card or items), choose one of your three Bakugan and throw them to where you wanted them to throw. It is possible to either let it directly get on one of the gate cards or to move it to items, trampolines, or other locations that will give your Bakugan extra G-power.

In the video game, different Bakugan have different special attacks, which can be activated once the special meter is full. special attacks do various things, such as knocking Bakugan off of gate cards or shooting into the air to reach platforms.

If two Bakugan stand on one gate card the fight starts. You can now activate ability cards in order to power-up your Bakugan even more or to change the battle rules. The fight itself is nothing more than one of three different mini-games (shooting, shaking, and pressing buttons at the right time). With the help of these mini-games both Bakugan gain more G-Power, which decides after it who will win the fight.

The winner gets the gate card and a new battle can begin.

Who is able to collect three gate cards will win the entire brawl. The winner earns BP (Bakugan Points) to upgrade their Bakugan, buy new Bakugan, buy new gate cards, or buy new ability cards.

Source: Wikipedia, "List of Bakugan Battle Brawlers video games", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101048.name: Gex: Enter the Gecko

videogamehonor.29605: 1998 D.I.C.E. Best Action Game of the Year Nominee (Console)

101048.description:
Enter the Gecko is Gex's first foray into 3D world. His main moveset involves a tail whip attack, bouncing on his tail, using his tongue to eat flies, and performing a karate kick. He can also climb up on certain surfaces, and swim underwater.

The game takes place in a large hub filled with several TV screens based on various genres, parodying various genres from Looney Tunes to Star Wars. Each level has about three remotes to collect, as well as an additional one for collecting 120 collectibles within the level. Collecting enough remotes unlock new areas, bonus levels and boss levels.

Source: Wikipedia, "Gex: Enter the Gecko", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101049.name: Run Run Dash!
101049.description:
How long can you survive the desert onslaught?? Dodge waves of diving bluebirds hell-bent on attacking!

Run left, run right and dash out of the way in your quest to remain. Collect power-ups, and unlock a cache of hidden achievements! Why are there bluebirds attacking you in the desert, you ask? We’ll let you know when we find out!

Features:

- 50+ Game Center™ achievements to attain
- Powerful power-ups help you survive
- Classic 8-bit graphics & hypnotic music
- Super-addictive gameplay action
- FREE Universal app available on iPhone™, iPod™ & iPad™

Source: The Game Website.

101050.name: Bakugan Battle Brawlers (DS)
101050.description:
Bakugan Battle Brawlers is a video game based on the original anime series made by NOW Production and Activision

The Bakugan battles are very different from the anime series and the general rules. At the beginning take a gate card, which will land on the field. Then you have to target an aim on the battlefield (like a gate card or items), choose one of your three Bakugan and throw them to where you wanted them to throw. It is possible to either let it directly get on one of the gate cards or to move it to items, trampolines, or other locations that will give your Bakugan extra G-power.

In the video game, different Bakugan have different special attacks, which can be activated once the special meter is full. special attacks do various things, such as knocking Bakugan off of gate cards or shooting into the air to reach platforms.

If two Bakugan stand on one gate card the fight starts. You can now activate ability cards in order to power-up your Bakugan even more or to change the battle rules. The fight itself is nothing more than one of three different mini-games (shooting, shaking, and pressing buttons at the right time). With the help of these mini-games both Bakugan gain more G-Power, which decides after it who will win the fight.

The winner gets the gate card and a new battle can begin.

Who is able to collect three gate cards will win the entire brawl. The winner earns BP (Bakugan Points) to upgrade their Bakugan, buy new Bakugan, buy new gate cards, or buy new ability cards.

Source: Wikipedia, "List of Bakugan Battle Brawlers video games", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101051.name: Caverns of the Dead
101051.description:
user summary

Dungeon Planner Set 1 includes detailed background on the setting "Eastern Koss", an adventure "Caverns of the Dead", and 25mm maps which are compatible with the Dungeon Floor Plans by GW.

101052.name: Legendary Wars
101052.description:
Welcome to Legendary Wars

Legendaria is under attack! Join Lucas the knight on a heroic quest to fight back the undead forces of the Netherworld. Along the way discover the secrets surrounding the mysterious Sunstones and the fabled Phoenix. Build up massive armies with seven unique heroes, including Elven Archers, Hulking Golems, Powerful Wizards, and Magical Unicorns. Your journey will put you toe to toe with over 20 different monsters and 12 evil bosses bent on your demise. It's up to you to save Legendaria.

RTS-ACTION-RPG: Legendary Wars features a variety of gameplay styles including; castle defense, castle siege, ambush, side-scrolling, free build, and Hero control. All while commanding a massive army to victory!

Features

Campaign mode features 5 lands and over 50 levels each with unique gameplay and unlockable modes.
Experience a new freedom in hybrid gameplay as you take direct control of any hero on the battlefield and unleash their special attacks!
Customize and upgrade your heroes through the game to unlock powerful new attacks and two sets of Legendary Armor per character.
Super-smooth animation and 6 beautiful environments with eye-popping parallax scrolling give a fantastic look to the game.
Battle Skullys, Zombies, Wolfys, Vamps, Trolls, Gargoyles and Dragons designed with AI to challenge and hunt you down.




Source: The Game Website.

101053.name: Gex: Enter the Gecko (GBC version)
101053.description:
User Summary

This is the GBC release of Gex: Enter the Gecko that, unlike its PC/PSX/N64 counterparts, is a 2D side-scrolling platformer.

101054.name: Victory March
101054.description:
User Summary

Victory March is a WW2-themed run-and-gun game. It includes 6 different levels, 2 gameplay modes, and a huge range of weapons and enemies.

101055.name: Rip Off
101055.description:
With his parents away at work, a tiny bird must protect his brothers and sisters - still just eggs! You control a ninja-like bird capable of slashing through countless enemies.

Source: The Developer Website.

101056.name: Fantasy Chronicles (Issue 3 - Sep 1986)
101056.description:
Vol I, No. 3

Cover Artist: Jim Fitzpatrick

101057.name: Monster Rush
101057.description:
MONSTER RUSH is an addictive, pickup-and-play action game wich puts you in the heart of all-out monster carnage.

TWO DIFFERENT MODES FOR DOUBLE THE FUN
Try to beat the maximun number of monsters in Classic Mode but dont forget that if you miss 3 of then your journey will be over and the monsters will conquest our planet. The Arcade is the most challenging mode. How many monsters you can beat in 60 seconds? Try it and compare your result with other players around the world

CUTE GRAPHICS OPTIMIZED FOR RETINA DISPLAY
Experience the adorable world of Monster Rush unfold in hi-res graphics

Source: The Game Website.

101058.name: Akuji the Heartless
101058.description:
The game centres around the voodoo priest and warrior Akuji (voiced by Richard Roundtree), who had his heart ripped out on his wedding day, and through the use of voodoo magic is now cursed to wander the Underworld. However, Kaisha, his would-be bride, finds him in hell and speaks to him in soul form: she informs him that it was Orad, Akuji's own brother, who orchestrated his murder. She begs Akuji to escape and stop him, as their families are preparing for war, and Orad is preparing to sacrifice her to the gods. Upon traveling through the first level of the Underworld and consulting loa Baron Samedi Akuji discovers he has a chance for redemption: if he traverses hell and collects the souls of his ancestors, which the Baron despises for their evil, then he will grant Akuji safe passage out of the underworld. On his way through, he must also defeat the wardens of each of the spirit gates, which will enable him to advance on his quest for the souls.

Source: Wikipedia, "Akuji the Heartless", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101059.name: Fantasy Chronicles (Issue 4 - Oct 1986)
101059.description:
Vol I, No. 4

Cover Artist: Jim Fitzpatrick

101060.name: Robotek HD
101060.description:
THE HUMANITY HAD FALLEN

In the great robot uprising machines took the planet over.

Empire of Machine is the new world order.

WELCOME HUMAN

It's time to take your world back.

One node at a time.

FEATURES

Unique blend of strategy, action and RPG.
More than 200 levels spread all around the world.
Rewarding skill system with more than 30 levels.
9 upgradable slot symbols to fit your own style of play.
4 special abilities including the devastating Nuke.
Play thrilling hotseat duels with your friends!
Online hall of fame - Your scores can only grow.
Facebook leaderboards - compete with your friends!
Signature soundtrack by kubatko




Source: The Game Website.

101062.name: Space Inversion
101062.description:
The enhanced version of the classic shooter in HD for the iPhone.
Features a 'classic' and 'turbo' mode, with additional 'bonus' stages.

Features


Fast addictive action
Two modes of play "classic" and "Turbo"
Special Bonus saucer rounds
Out of this world graphics
HD graphics specially designed for iPad and iPhone4
A list of customizable controls including accelerometer controls


Source: The Game Website.

101063.name: Fantasy Chronicles (Issue 7 - Jan 1987)
101063.description:
Vol I, No. 7

Cover Artist: Jim Fitzpatrick

(Articles to follow)

101064.name: Flick Golf!
101064.description:
User Summary

Using your finger, flick, spin and curve your shots to into the hole, while avoiding the usual hazards: bunkers, trees, sand, and of the wind.

Try to shoot the perfect score in Quickshot mode. Or play on the World Tour, from the USA’s West Coast to Japan in the Far East.

101065.name: Flick Golf Extreme!
101065.description:
User Summary

The sequel to Flick Golf! As before, use your finger to drive, chip, and putt the ball in a series of beautiful 3D environments. In addition to the Quick Shot and World Tour modes, Extreme! also offers the challenging Five Ball mode.

101066.name: Mower Ride
101066.description:
Gardening goes extreme in this hilarious high-speed racing game for iPhone and iPod touch. Mower Ride mounts you on a manic, motorized lawnmower that rockets through gardens, crashes through fences and trashes the grass-cutting competition! Do you have what it takes to ride the demented Mower Ride through middle-class horticulture?

Source: The Developer Website.

101067.name: iQuarterback 2
101067.description:
iQuarterback 2 lets you take your football career to a whole new level. Whether you're throwing footballs in the snow at moving targets or trying to power-up to achieve the highest score. With the all new Fame, you will have more control over the outcome and look of the game than ever before. Unlock interesting items like mascot heads, snow balls and different environments, such as an air hockey table. Level up your quarterback in two different game play modes, Shoot Out or Accuracy, and see how you stack up against the best of the best. Battle between your friends through the Game Center achievements and high scores.

Source: The Developer Website.

101068.name: The Clock Strikes
101068.description:
designer summary

The Clock Strikes is my entry for the 2010 RPG Solitaire Challenge.

You are a Clock. Not just a clock, but a Clock. You are special. You’ve hung on the wall for months, keeping perfect time. Until now. A week ago, your battery started to run down. Your second hand began to hang just a blink too long on the ticks. Before you knew it, you were a whole 30 seconds slow! This is Unacceptable. And you’re not going to stand for it!

The Clock Strikes is a roleplaying game you play alone. You are a Clock striking out to solve a problem and encountering horrible, horrible obstacles along the way.

101069.name: Balloon Pop
101069.description:
Balloon Pop is a video game released for the Wii in North America on October 23, 2007. It is the first puzzle strategy game released for the Wii. The objective of the game is to pop balloons using the Wii Remote. There are various modes including Story Mode, Puzzle Mode, and VS CPU mode. Balloon Pop can support up to two players.

Source: Wikipedia, "Balloon Pop", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101070.name: Balls of Fury
101070.description:
Two video games based on Balls of Fury were released for Wii and Nintendo DS by Black Lantern. The storyline involves an underground ping-pong competition, based on the film.

Source: Wikipedia, "Balls of Fury (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101071.name: Super Photon Racing
101071.description:
Get back to your arcade racing roots! Photon Creations presents Super Photon Racing, a top-down racing game based on the classic old skool arcade racing games.

Race your Photon Car through a variety of tracks and game modes. From racing in a championship to competing against people around the world to set the best lap times, to racing against a friend/foe on the same device in the unique 2 player mode.

GP MODE
3 GP cups all with 3 different difficulty levels. Get 3rd place or better in each cup to unlock the harder difficulties.

QUICK RACE MODE
Select a track, difficulty, opponents and lap count and just race.

2 PLAYER MODE
A unique mode where both players use the same device to compete against each other and the AI.

TIME TRIAL MODE
Compete against players around the world to set the best lap times for each track. Ingame best-laps & ranking provides realtime updating as you set your best lap.

Source: The Game Website.

101072.name: Cell Splat
101072.description:
An explosion in the Photon Labs has let loose all the dangerous experimental cells. As a lab assistant, it's your job now to clean up the mess by getting rid of the cells.

Cell Splat is an arcade game where you must tap the cells that match the target cell on the top of the screen. Each level will require more cells to be hit and at a faster pace.

Source: The Game Website.

101073.name: Traffic Trouble
101073.description:
The traffic lights at a nearby intersection have gone haywire. The lights work, but nothing to control them. The traffic is in trouble and it is now up to you to help direct traffic!

The object is simple: Keep your traffic moving as best as you can. But dont hold cars up too long! If you’re Rage-O-Meter becomes full then its game over. Fire trucks, Police Cars and Ambulances will need to get quickly across your busy intersection too.

And if it all becomes too much then just enjoy creating traffic havoc by setting all the lights green!

Source: The Game Website.

101074.name: Carnivores: Ice Age
101074.description:
Carnivores: Ice Age throws you onto a recently discovered planet to test your aiming and tactical skills on a realistic ice safari. The game delivers an intelligent hunting experience and offers a lot more than a visit to a shooting range. Unrivaled possibility to wander around open 3D world without limits makes the process of finding prey exciting and the whole game endlessly replayable.

The hunter, equipped with weapons and all sorts of hunting accessories like camouflage and cover scent, needs not only to be quiet as a mouse when approaching a saber-tooth beast but also take care of details like wind direction not to end up as animal’s dinner. Advanced AI of the animals turn them from dummy targets to aggressive hosts protecting their planet and add a shooter feeling to the gameplay.

Pack your things and start hunting in Carnivores: Ice Age if you are ready to explore the new huge world and think before you shoot.

Source: The Developer Website.

101075.name: Aqueduct
101075.description:
User Summary

Aqueduct is a puzzle game set among pipes and waterways. You must restore the flow of water. But locked gates, shifty conveyor belts, puzzling warp portals, and more stand in your way. The game features over 190 unique puzzles.

101076.name: Dune Rider
101076.description:
Tear around the desert in your nitro fueled Dune Rider. Jump off sand dunes, ramps, cliffs or whatever you can find and pull mid air stunts. Perform spectacular tricks, earn cash, unlock better cars and discover new worlds for the ultimate ride.

Source: The Developer Website.

101077.name: Storm over Pearl Harbor
101077.description: A new game of Storm over series. This time, the game covers the whole Pacific war from Pearl Harbor to the end of war. One year is covered with 3 game turns. The map covers from West coast to Bombay. The game engine is an advanced storm over system in which you can build your own card hands by selecting cards. Though the game covers naval actions and air combat, the most important thing is occupying the territory by Army. The victory is determined by Victory points which mainly come from the important land areas.

101078.name: Racing Coins
101078.description:
Find your way trough 40 levels packed with tricks and secrets. Unlock special abilities and master them to reach the goal.

Key features:

- Retina display optimization!
- Two scenarios and 40 levels.. and more to come!
- Special weapons
- Choose between 9 different coins set to play with spreading all the world
- Realistic physic with the Nvidia Physx engine!
- Many tricks to learn and accurate control

Source: The Developer Website.

101079.name: GI Joyride
101079.description:
War is hell, so it's time for some shore leave! Don't stop for anything as you blaze through enemy territory in your souped up APC (Armoured Personnel Carrier). Nothing and nobody will stand in your way to have a good time!

Source: The Game Website.

101080.description:
Two out-of-this-world maps challenge your railroad building and delivering prowess.

Outer Space requires "straight on" deliveries to ensure you don't shoot right by your destination, as well as a handy set of wormholes to get your goods across the galaxy quickly. Things are quite different in Reversteam, where not only has the traditional "great lakes" area been altered, but the cities want every kind of good except for their color.

Available as part of the 2011 Steam/Age of Steam preorder pack from Bézier Games.
101080.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Outer Space & Reversteam

101081.description:
Go down under as you build railways across the uninhabitable Outback and through mysterious Tasmania.

In Australia, quickly build along the expensive coastal regions of the East Coast and find a way to reach the cities in the west, which will pay more for goods delivered to them. Tasmania requires you to build an efficient distribution system for all of its towns and cities as goods are shuttled in from the mainland.

Part of the Spiel 2011 AoS/Steam map pack from Bézier Games.
101081.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Australia & Tasmania

101082.description:
Harness the power of railroads to dig up diamonds and produce much sought after wooden cubes.

African Diamond Mines has you setting up a mining railroad deep underground to access valuable diamonds with a new depth counter that adds an additional level of strategy. Ramp up production with Taiwan Cube Factories, as you combine resources to produce new ones to keep the new infrastructure in Taiwan booming.

Part of the 2011 Steam/Age of Steam map pack from Bézier Games.
101082.name: Age of Steam Expansion: African Diamond Mines & Taiwan Cube Factories

101083.description:
Special preorder-only maps that are challenging in new ways.

Orient Express is the classic European channel between Paris and Istanbul, where moving passengers quickly and effectively is your goal. On the other hand, Disoriented Express will have you scratching your head trying to undo the knots created by foreign, yet familiar landscapes. ​

These two maps are available ONLY as part of the Spiel 2011 AoS/Steam map pack from Bézier Games.
101083.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Orient Express & Disoriented Express

101085.name: Barbie and the 3 Musketeers
101085.description:
User Summary

Barbie and the 3 Musketeers is an adventure game that combines the fun of Barbie with the classic tale. The player takes control of Corinne, a French peasant girl who dreams of becoming a musketeer. Using her skills and abilities, she needs to overcome challenges alongside her three musketeer hopeful friends.

101087.name: Barbie Horse Adventures: Riding Camp
101087.description:
User Summary

Barbie Horse Adventures: Riding Camp is another game in the Barbie franchise. Players control Barbie as she learns to ride, groom, and care for all the horses at riding camp. There are several riding disciplines, including jumping and time trials. Completing tasks will unlock hidden clothes and accessories, allowing the player to deck out Barbie in the perfect outfit.

101088.name: Barbie as the Island Princess
101088.description:
Barbie: The Island Princess is a video game of the Barbie franchise. This game is a collection of 28 different mini-games. Some of the mini-games are more frustrating to play than others due to the inconsistencies in the difficulty level. Barbie can unlock new locations by succeeding at the mini-games.

Source: Wikipedia, "Barbie as the Island Princess (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101090.name: Barbie as the Island Princess (GBA/DS)
101090.description:
Barbie: The Island Princess is a video game of the Barbie franchise. This game is a collection of 28 different mini-games. Some of the mini-games are more frustrating to play than others due to the inconsistencies in the difficulty level. Barbie can unlock new locations by succeeding at the mini-games.

Source: Wikipedia, "Barbie as the Island Princess (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101091.name: Continuity

rpghonor.13625: 2011 ENnie for Best Electronic Book - Gold Winner

101091.description:
From Eclipse Phase Website: Continuity is a short adventure for Eclipse Phase. The characters, researchers on a remote outpost, check in for a backup--and awaken in new bodies to discover two weeks of their lives are missing. They have limited time to find out what happened to their previous selves--and deal with a looming threat.

Continuity is designed as a one-shot scenario using sample characters from the Eclipse Phase core rulebook or Sunward but can also be used as a campaign's introductory scenario or otherwise modified for use in a campaign.

101092.name: Barnyard
101092.description:
Barnyard is a 2006 party game based on the animated film of the same name.

Since it does not follow the script of the movie, the game instead allows the player to create a cow, boy or girl, and choose different fur colors and patterns. Once the character creation process is completed, the player can begin to do missions for other characters. They can also receive missions through their cell phones, via text message. In the beginning the player may only explore inside the barnyard, but after several of missions revolving around the main characters the player receives a key to the barnyard gate and a key for a bicycle, and the player is able to explore other parts of the neighborhood. Also, the missions cannot be skipped; they must be completed in order for the game to advance. Then, eventually, after a multitude of missions, the player will have to complete a boss level involving coyotes, and then the player finishes the game and is free to roam.

Source: Wikipedia, "Barnyard (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101093.name: Barnyard (GBA)
101093.description:
Barnyard is a 2006 party game based on the animated film of the same name.

Since it does not follow the script of the movie, the game instead allows the player to create a cow, boy or girl, and choose different fur colors and patterns. Once the character creation process is completed, the player can begin to do missions for other characters. They can also receive missions through their cell phones, via text message. In the beginning the player may only explore inside the barnyard, but after several of missions revolving around the main characters the player receives a key to the barnyard gate and a key for a bicycle, and the player is able to explore other parts of the neighborhood. Also, the missions cannot be skipped; they must be completed in order for the game to advance. Then, eventually, after a multitude of missions, the player will have to complete a boss level involving coyotes, and then the player finishes the game and is free to roam.

Source: Wikipedia, "Barnyard (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101094.name: Baseball Blast!
101094.description:
Overview

Baseball Blast! is the official game of family fun night for Wii™! The whole family will enjoy more than 20 action-packed, baseball-themed mini-games, hosted by “Mr. Baseball” legend Bob Uecker and packed with your favorite stars of Major League Baseball®. Step up to the plate and have a blast playing Pitcher Perfect, Dodge Ball, Bumper Base, Galaxy Ball, Slide!Slide! and many more, all using the Wii Remote™. Rack up points and unlock trophies, puzzles, and even earn cool strategy cards. With hours of fun to be had, you’ll be an All-Star in no time. Play Ball!

Features

Mr. Baseball Bob Uecker and Rob Dibble call the play-by-play in this zany baseball experience.

- Test your baseball knowledge with a challenging trivia mode.

- Unlock trophies and puzzles, and earn strategy cards.

- Compete in Baseball Blast! Play Ball, a round-robin multiplayer game of batting and baserunning featuring unique strategy cards earned by playing each of the mini-games.

Source: The Developer Website.

101095.name: Rolemaster Quarterly (Issue 3 - Oct 2006)
101095.description:
Issue 3
October 2006

This issue is dedicated to Steve Erwin. He will be remembered.

101096.name: Bass Pro Shops: The Strike
101096.description:
User Summary

Bass Pro Shops: The Strike is a fishing game for the Wii, Xbox 360, and PC. Players can try their hand at fishing in a number of lake across North America, and in a variety of play modes.

Features

- Career mode requires players to learn how to best use their equipment and understand fish behaviour if they want to excel.

- 10 of North America's most famous lakes are presented in detail for exploration.

- A wide range of fish are included, such as Striped Bass, Walleye, and Largemouth Bass.

- The Pro Shop lets players customize their tackle to prepare for the most challenging catches: the legendary fish hiding in each lake.

101097.name: 1 vs. 100 (handheld)
101097.description:
The game's rules are identical to the game show's: A question is posed, and both the single contestant and members of the "mob" must guess at the answer. If the contestant gets the question wrong, the game is over and the prize money is split up amongst the mob. If the contestant gets the answer right, members of the mob who got the question wrong are eliminated, and the value of each question goes up for the solo player as the mob thins out. The contestant can opt to quit with their winnings at any time, or press their luck and continue on.

Source: Wikipedia, "1 vs. 100 (Nintendo DS)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101098.name: Agent X (Arcade)
101098.description:
User Summary

A rebranding of Atari's Cloak and Dagger with a new cabinet and controls. Play this 'spy' game. Try to make your way through levels while avoiding all kinds of ruthless traps.

101099.name: Cloak & Dagger
101099.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "Cloak & Dagger (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Cloak & Dagger is an Atari video game based on the 1984 film of the same name. The video game was critical to the movie's plot. This collaboration was part of a larger phenomenon at the time of movies featuring video games as critical plot elements (as with Tron and The Last Starfighter) and of video game tie-ins to the same movies (as with the Tron games for the Intellivision and other platforms).

101100.name: 1 vs. 100
101100.description:
User Summary

An Xbox Live adaption of the television game show, one player was selected to be the 'One' who competed against hundred players selected to be the 'Mob'. Hundreds of thousands of other users were part of the 'Crowd'. The winners won from a pool of 10,000 Microsoft points and had the chance to win Xbox Live Arcade games.

101101.name: Akka Arrh
101101.description:
User Summary

An Atari space combat game. Protect your spaceship from oncoming enemies while also trying to stop the enemy from building a cannon which will destroy you.

101102.name: Atari Baseball
101102.description:
User Summary

An early baseball game from Atari. Play the traditional game of baseball from an overhead view with very simple black and white graphics.

101103.name: Atari Basketball
101103.description:
User Summary
An early Atari Basketball game in black and white. It is a 3/4 view game of 1x1 play.

101104.name: Atari Soccer
101104.description:
User Summary

A soccer game for 1-4 players. Play view is from the top. Try to score goals.

101105.name: 7 Wonders II
101105.description:
7 Wonders instantly transports you back in time to far away lands to complete an unbelievable mission: building the 7 Wonders. This new adventure introduces you to forgotten, yet magnificent structures such as Stonehenge and the Taj Mahal. You'll be dazzled with incredible new power-ups and bonuses and intrigued as you receive pieces of a hidden map, which ultimately uncovers a secret route leading to a wondrous sight that only the best get to see.

Source: The Game Website.

101106.name: 7th Dragon
101106.description:
7th Dragon takes place in the world of Eden of which 80% is ruled by dragons, so the premise of the game is simple: Kill all the dragons, or the human race is going to be wiped out of existence.
When players start their journey, they can create their own characters from the following classes: Mage, Princess, Rogue, Knight, Samurai, Fighter, or Healer. Outside of battle the characters will be viewed traveling the overworld from an overhead perspective, while the battles are viewed from a side perspective showing each character as they attack their foes.

Source: Wikipedia, "7th Dragon", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101107.name: Ankh: Curse of the Scarab King
101107.description:
Ankh: Curse of the Scarab King is an adventure game for the Nintendo DS. It was released in Europe on 17 September 2008. This is the fourth game in the Ankh series.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ankh: Curse of the Scarab King", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101108.name: Answer That!
101108.description: This "Scene It?" variant is based on the Christian children's radio show "Adventures in Odyssey." Players take turns rolling a die and moving their character around a game board. There are five different kinds of trivia categories that can be landed on, including two that utilize a DVD player. First person to get to the end of the board wins. The DVD also features a boardless "Lightning Play" mode said to be best for fast play or a party situation.

101111.name: Pac-Man Collection
101111.description:
Pac-Man Collection (パックマンコレクション, Pakkuman Korekushon?) is a compilation of four Pac-Man games, released in 2001 and 2002 for the Game Boy Advance: Pac-Man, Pac-Mania and Pac-Man Arrangement, all ports of arcade games which follow the essence of classic Pac-Man gameplay; and Pac-Attack, a falling-block puzzle game originally released on the Super Nintendo Entertainment System.

Due to the restrictive screen resolution of the Game Boy Advance, the player is given the choice of two methods for viewing the playfield in Pac-Man: scroll mode, where the playfield automatically scrolls to follow Pac-Man, or full-screen, where the entire playfield is displayed in miniature form.

With the exception of Pac-Attack, the player can alter various settings such as lives, difficulty and bonus life counters, similar to the DIP switch-enabled settings in the original arcade versions. Hints are available for each game.

This release is notable for the inclusion of Pac-Man Arrangement, a remixed, full-color update of Pac-Man with new power-ups and gameplay features. The game was released into arcades by Namco in 1996 as part of the Namco Classics range, but had never been ported to a home system prior to this release.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pac-Man Collection", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101112.name: Paws and Claws: Pet Vet
101112.description:
Players assume the role of a veterinarian running a pet clinic and must heal sick pets back to full health. At the beginning of the game, this involves treating smaller pets such as guinea pigs, rabbits, and birds. As the player gains experience, larger animals such as horses, dogs, or cats become available. The clinic's facilities can be expanded and altered (for instance, the style of kennels used to house the animals). Expanding facilities enables more pets to be housed and increases the range of treatments available. Players are also responsible for managing the clinic's finances and supplies.

Each type of pet has a different type of task to be completed in order to heal them. Dogs can play fetch and be taken for a run to increase their fitness and horses can be ridden and taken out to the pasture.

Source: Wikipedia, "Paws and Claws: Pet Vet", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101113.name: Serious Pursuit

17327.name: Navy and Marine Corps Intelligence Center

101113.description:
Subtitle: The "Evil Empire" Exposed

This is a military trivia training game developed by the United States armed forces.

"The basis of the game is an understanding of the Soviet Union through its history, personalities, capabilities and its allies. Soviet seapower is more than just ships, aircraft and doctrine. It is centered around the men. This game will provide you with an understanding of these sailors. There is nothing trivial about the Soviet Navy. They are our greatest maritime adversary.

The following play equipment or implements are included with the game:

Colorful Game Board showing militaristic spaces printed in English and Russian; Assortment of Different Colored Wooden 'Ships'; Assortment of Different Colored Playing Chits; Five sets of question cards; Large Rules Book with Answer Key; and, 2 Dice."

101114.name: American McGee's Grimm: Episode 1 – A Boy Learns What Fear Is
101114.description:
When a young boy goes on a quest to find the true meaning of fear, his trek takes a turn for the darker when Grimm appears to muck things up! Traverse on a quest for fear through the boy's hometown, the gallows, a local school, a graveyard and a haunted castle...and that's the uplifting part of the story! Happily ever after ends now!

Source: Wikipedia, "American McGee's Grimm", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101115.name: American McGee's Grimm: Episode 2 – Little Red Riding Hood
101115.description:
A little girl is sent to deliver goodies to her sick grandma, but when Grimm is thrown into the mix, someone's not coming out alive! Follow this classic story through a town in the woods, the local crossroads, Granny's place, the insides of the Big, Bad Wolf and the Woodsman's Den. Keep your eyes peeled, or the wolf's gonna get ya!

Source: Wikipedia, "American McGee's Grimm", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101116.name: Cyberball 2072 (360)
101116.description:
Atari Games released Tournament Cyberball 2072 in 1989, which included the following changes:

New "Game Breakers" mode
Added Rookie mode
Bugfixes, in particular the onside kick
Added 100 additional plays
Introduced the powerback

Owners of the original Cyberball cabinets could upgrade to Cyberball 2072 via an Atari Games-produced piggyback board which updated the old Cyberball units to the Tournament version.

Cyberball 2072 was released in [...] collection of arcade games, for the GameCube, PlayStation 2, and Xbox in October 2004. It was also released on Xbox Live Arcade for the Xbox 360 on September 5, 2007.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyberball#Cyberball_2072,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101117.name: American McGee's Grimm: Episode 3 – The Fisherman and His Wife
101117.description:
A poor fisherman hooks a magic fish, but his wife continues to want more and more...and more! Things can only get worse when Grimm comes for a visit! Help the fisherman as he journeys through his hovel on the shoreside, the local port, his wife's new digs, the local sailor town, his wife's church and a raging whirlpool on the coastline! Hope you know how to swim...because Grimm doesn't!

Source: Wikipedia, "American McGee's Grimm", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101118.description:
Summary from Columbia Games website:

"Borodino was fought between the Army of Imperial Russia and Napoleon's Grand Armee on September 7 1812. The battle ended with a French victory, but strategic defeat. Losses were terrible on both sides, but the Russians could replace theirs. One week after the battle Napoleon occupied an undefended Moscow, hoping to impose a peace, but after four weeks was forced to retreat home with calamitous results.

The historical battle involved wave after wave of frontal attacks by both sides, focusing on the Russian redoubts. However, the game will show all the options available to Napoleon and Kutuzov, including some not attempted historically. The French player has several possible lines of attack and the Russian player must try to anticipate and counter them all. The tactical interaction of Napoleonic infantry, cavalry and artillery is also emphasized, including cavalry charges and squares. This makes for exciting and tense gaming.

Movement and combat are resolved within areas. The game plays using the fast-paced Move-Move-Battle sequence seen in Hammer of the Scots and Shiloh. There are no cards involved; players activate leaders to command brigades of the same division of the same corps. Game time is 3-4 hours."

This game is scheduled to be released September 7, 2012.

Note: This game should not be confused with Borodino 1812 or Borodino 1812 or any other similarly-named games.
101118.name: Borodino 1812

101119.name: Capcom Classics Collection Volume 1
101119.description:
Capcom Classics Collection is a compilation of arcade games released by Capcom for the PlayStation 2 and Xbox on September 27, 2005. It was developed by Digital Eclipse Software (now Backbone Entertainment). In 1998, Capcom produced a series of five video game compilations titled Capcom Generations for the PlayStation and Sega Saturn, released in Japan and the PAL region. The series as a whole compiled over 15 arcade games and the Super NES game Super Ghouls 'n Ghosts. Each volume was accompanied by extra features such as a historical overview of each title, artwork gallery, hints and even cast profiles. All games in these compilations also contained enhanced gameplay options such as rapid fire, a bigger screen, and remixed soundtrack. Volume 1 of Capcom Classics Collection contains all sixteen games from Capcom Generations (converted from these ports rather than the arcade originals) and six added emulated titles.

This volume features:
1942
1943: The Battle of Midway
1943 Kai
Bionic Commando
Commando
Exed Exes
Final Fight
Forgotten Worlds
Ghosts 'n Goblins
Ghouls 'n Ghosts
Gun.Smoke
Legendary Wings
Mercs
Pirate Ship Higemaru
Section Z
SonSon
Street Fighter II
Street Fighter II: Champion Edition
Street Fighter II Turbo: Hyper Fighting
Super Ghouls 'n Ghosts
Trojan
Vulgus

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capcom_Classics_Collection#Volu...; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101120.name: Ostrich Circus
101120.description:
The game consists of the following:


60 playing cards, each with one of 6 pictures of ostriches performing various feats or being the victim of various misfortunes
4 declaration cards indicating whether players want to fold or continue
"Chicken" chips that are taken as a penalty when folding
Start player card
