Jake visits a race circuit at the invitation of one of Yulia's friends. A motorcycle racer, Sabin Olsen, crashes at the circuit, but a different racer's body is recovered from the crash site. At the same time, Sabin Olsen, at a hotel, is found where a man he was supposed to meet was killed causing Olsen to be framed as he fled the hotel.

Source: Wikipedia, "Jake Hunter", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

videogame.101262: Tantei Jinguuji Saburo: Kiken na Futari (Zengohen)

101261.name: Tantei Jinguuji Saburo: Kiken na Futari (Kouhen)

videogamecompilation.101262: Tantei Jinguuji Saburo: Kiken na Futari (Zengohen)

101261.description:
Jake Hunter, known in Japan as Tantei Jingūji Saburō (探偵神宮寺三郎?, Detective Saburō Jingūji) is a mystery-adventure game series originally developed by Data East in 1987, and later developed by WorkJam and other companies.

Jake visits a race circuit at the invitation of one of Yulia's friends. A motorcycle racer, Sabin Olsen, crashes at the circuit, but a different racer's body is recovered from the crash site. At the same time, Sabin Olsen, at a hotel, is found where a man he was supposed to meet was killed causing Olsen to be framed as he fled the hotel.

Source: Wikipedia, "Jake Hunter", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

videogame.101261: Tantei Jinguuji Saburo: Kiken na Futari (Kouhen)

101262.name: Tantei Jinguuji Saburo: Kiken na Futari (Zengohen)

videogamecompilation.101261: Tantei Jinguuji Saburo: Kiken na Futari (Kouhen)

101262.description:
Jake Hunter, known in Japan as Tantei Jingūji Saburō (探偵神宮寺三郎?, Detective Saburō Jingūji) is a mystery-adventure game series originally developed by Data East in 1987, and later developed by WorkJam and other companies.

Jake visits a race circuit at the invitation of one of Yulia's friends. A motorcycle racer, Sabin Olsen, crashes at the circuit, but a different racer's body is recovered from the crash site. At the same time, Sabin Olsen, at a hotel, is found where a man he was supposed to meet was killed causing Olsen to be framed as he fled the hotel.

Source: Wikipedia, "Jake Hunter", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101263.name: Zoids: Mokushiroku
101263.description:
User Summary

This Japanese Famicom game was released by Tomy Corporation and is based on the Zoids toys. The game was released on December 21, 1990 and is a Japanese exclusive. The game was later re-released on the Wii Virtual console in 2009. The Wii release was also a Japanese exclusive.

101264.name: Bratz Kidz
101264.description:
Welcome to the Bratz Kidz Slumber Party! Join your favourite Bratz Kidz characters for a game filled with all the fun of a late night party - no boys allowed!

Yasmin is hosting a sleepover. As our 4 girls look through Yasmin's photo album, they remember all their craziest times together and embark on an adventure based on each of the memories in the album! Explore the adventure mode or dip in and out of a series of fun mini games where you customise your favourite Bratz Kidz characters. You can also make a delicious pizza for your girlfriends, take stylish photos, create your very own clothes and much more in this sassy sleepover!

Select, customize and play with your favourite Bratz Kidz. Jade is really respectful, Sasha is very dynamic, Yasmin is self-confident and Cloe is sweet - and of course they're all sparky, adventurous and cool.

Join the Bratz Kidz Slumber Party in this sleepover themed world with an adventure based on Jasmine's photo album full of memories. The game stimulates the player's creativity and imagination with focus on fun, fashion and glamour! The kidz with a passion for fun are waiting for you to arrive . . .

Key Features:

Play 13 brilliant mini-games and activities including choreography, music and clothes design, Friendship tests and photo-sessions!

Collect stars use them to buy items to customise your character in the Bratz Kidz shop

Fully customise with over 350 accessories options including hairstyle, make-up, manicure, clothes, shoes and jewellery – totalling 843750 different combinations!

Play in Freeplay or Album mode, then choose Competition or

Play with up to 3 friends in multiplayer mode. Exchange items, play mini-games and more!

Complete all the mini-games and unlock exclusive scenes from the Bratz Kidz “Sleep Over Party” DVD

Source: The Developer Website.

101265.name: Bratz Kidz (DS)
101265.description:
Welcome to the Bratz Kidz Party! Join your favourite Bratz Kidz characters for a sleepover themed party game filled with all the fun and excitement of a late night party – no boys allowed!

Yasmin is hosting a sleepover for all of her girlfriends – but the party can't start without you! Customise your favourite Bratz Kidz characters and their individual bedrooms in a series of fun mini games. You can also bake a delicious cake for your girlfriends, take stylish photos, create your very own accessories and much more in this sweet and sassy sleepover!

Features:

- 13 brilliant mini-games and activities involving fashion magazines, cooking, memory-games, and photo-sessions!
- Customise your character with tons of accessories, clothing and styling options including hairstyle, make-up, manicure, clothes, shoes and jewellery.
- Customise your character’s bedroom – pick everything from wallpaper, curtains and carpets to furniture, plants and more!
- Save up to 4 personalised Bratz Kidz profiles and bedrooms on your cartridge!
- Play with up to 3 friends in multiplayer. Exchange items, play the mini-games, compete in contests and more!
- The game takes full advantage of the Nintendo DS microphone and stylus

Source: The Developer Website.

101266.name: Getsu Fūma Den
101266.description:
Getsu Fūma Den (月風魔伝?, lit. "Legend of Getsu Fūma" or "The Legend of the Lunar Wind Demon") is an action role-playing game for the Nintendo Entertainment System by Konami, released in 1987. This game was never released outside of Japan, although console emulation hobbyists have translated the game into English.

In the first year of the Demon Age（1467), a horrible demon named Dragon Master was revived by his minions in hell. To protect the peace of the overworld, the two eldest Fūma brothers fought the Dragon Master. Both were unable to defeat him and were killed, losing their legendary Hadouken ("wave") swords. To avenge their deaths, the last of the Fūma brothers vowed to slay the Dragon Master and retrieve the swords. The lead character, Getsu Fūma, is based on the real-life 16th century ninja Fūma Kotarō.

Source: Wikipedia, "Getsu Fūma Den", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101267.name: Bratz: The Movie
101267.description:
Join the Bratz as they meet music celebrities, design fashions and dish out the hottest magazine ever. Share the glitz and glamour of becoming real movie stars.

Features

- Shine in the spotlight and play your own guitar.
- Design your own clothes for the red carpet.
- Train, feed and dress up your pet.
- Take glamour pictures using your camera.
- Features music from the TV show.

Source: The Developer Website.

101268.name: Arctic Thunder
101268.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "Arctic Thunder", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Arctic Thunder is a snowmobile racing game developed by Midway Games released as an arcade game as well as on PlayStation 2 and Xbox consoles, being a launch title for the latter. In the arcade version of the game, jets blow cold or hot winds, depending on the setting, in the player's face while he or she plays the game. This is a part of Midway's Thunder series, which also included Hydro Thunder, 4 Wheel Thunder, and Offroad Thunder. The Xbox version of this game is not currently compatible with the Xbox 360.

101269.name: Carnevil
101269.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "CarnEvil", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

CarnEvil is a rail shooter arcade game using a light gun. Released by Midway Games on October 31 (Halloween), 1998, the game focuses on the protagonist fighting their way through a supernatural carnival that features horror-themed twists on many familiar amusement park elements.

101270.description:
A strategy game as players guide their Frog on a gourmet buffet across the lillypads.

In this simple strategy game, each player plays a Frog with his own special menu of what tastes good on the pond. He moves his frog in large or small movements across the lillypads, snapping up insects as he goes. The trick is in only getting the insects you like more than the ones you don't like. Each Frog has his own special secret diet, you don't know what each frog is after. Be careful, predators surround the pond looking for a meal of frog.

The simple mechanics can be learned in minutes by children and adults alike. Play is quick and intuitive, setup is fast with variable board setup to change the game every time. Random menus for each frog ensures uncertainty about other players intentions and strategies.

The game includes rule expansions to challenge experienced gamers and those who become experienced with the game.

Designed as Print n' Play, they game can be produced in either a high or low quality finish.

Available July 2011.
101270.name: Leaping Lillypads

101271.name: Bratz: The Movie (GBA)

videogameversion.104442: North American Game Boy Advance edition

101271.description:
Bratz: The Movie is a video game of the Bratz franchise. This game is based on episodes from the TV series of bratz and is not based on the film with the same name, video game, Bratz 4 Real is based on the film.

Features

- Attend the Stylesville Music Academy to learn the hottest Bratz songs to perform in fashion shows.

- Enhanced pet features: swap pets at anytime, find out your pet’s mood and collect different pet palaces for your pet to live in.

- Play as all four Bratz girls (Cloe, Jade, Sasha, and Yasmin) and experience character-specific adventures.

- Huge array of all-new hair styles, clothing lines, make-up kits, and accessories to choose from.

- Travel to New York and London.

- New ice skating moves.

- Design your very own jackets, tops, pants, skirts, and shoes for the girls to wear.

- After the credits roll you can play in freestyle mode and shop, travel, and collect all the Bratz tokens etc.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bratz: The Movie (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101272.name: Cart Fury
101272.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "CART Fury", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

CART Fury is a 2000 arcade-style racing video game based on the Champ Car World Series (formerly known then as CART-Championship Auto Racing Teams). It was NOT based on Indy Racing League racing as previously stated in this article. The IRL was a totally separate and rival racing series to CART. and some of its famous drivers like Juan Pablo Montoya (1999 series champion from Bogota, Colombia), Michael Andretti (USA) and Christian Fittipaldi (Brazil). The game features the voice of Danny Sullivan, who won the CART championship in 1988. There are six speakers of sound and the game is suitable for all ages. Licensed music by Disturbed and Outkast are used as the official soundtrack of this game

101273.name: Double Cheese
101273.description:
User Summary
In Double Cheese, you try to spin and stop the wheel to hit the best spots and get tickets by matching numbers.

101275.name: The Grid
101275.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "The Grid (arcade game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

The Grid is a 2001 arcade game by Midway. It is a third person shooter in the form of a super-violent television game show hosted by a Smash TV-like host. It was created by the developers behind the Mortal Kombat series of games. It also has cameos from the Mortal Kombat characters Sub-Zero, Scorpion, and Noob Saibot. This was Midway's last arcade game.

101276.name: Hyperdrive
101276.description:
User Summary

A hovercraft racing game with new-for-the-age 3d graphics. Race several different courses with varying levels of diffiuclty. Beat the clock to progress.

101277.name: Brave: A Warrior's Tale
101277.description:
Set in a fantastic world based upon the mythology of Native America, Brave: A Warrior's Tale plays as a series of flashbacks in which a now elderly Brave describes the events of his life. Players take on the role of Courage and experience Brave's legendary adventures first hand as they relive his story and play through all-new content that will make Courage a legend in his own right! Can Courage live up to his name and stop the evil Wendigo's threat to their village?

Source: The Developer Website.

101278.name: Invasion:  The Abductors
101278.description:
User Summary

A two player light gun shooter where you shoot aliens trying to enslave humanity.

101279.name: NBA Maximum Hangtime
101279.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "NBA Hangtime", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

NBA Maximum Hangtime is an upgrade to the arcade version of NBA Hangtime featuring 1997 NBA rosters. Otherwise, the gameplay is essentially the same except for the addition of a hidden "hot spot" on the court for each player where they shoot more accurately. "Maximum" also has some additional secret codes and hidden players.

101280.name: Skins Game
101280.description:
User Summary

A realistic golf game from Midway. Play on 3 different 18 hole courses. Follows normal golf rules for play.

101281.name: Super High Impact
101281.description:
User Summary

A sequel to High Impact. Play up to 4 players in this fun football game. Plays following the standard American Football rules.

Players are able to pick from 18 teams. Game has no ties with the NFL, but has the following NFL cities as choices for your team: Atlanta, Buffalo, Cincinnati, Chicago, Denver, Detroit, Kansas City, Miami, New York, Oakland, Pittsburgh, San Francisco and Washington. The 5 other teams are: L.A., Texas, Vegas, Europa, and Africa.

Both offense and defense pick from 15 plays. 3 difficulty levels are present. Game includes fighting and the Hit-O-Meter.

101282.name: Total Carnage
101282.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "Total Carnage", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

In Total Carnage, an evil Middle Eastern dictator named General Akhboob closes off his country to the rest of the world following a war in 1999. Hundreds of reporters flocked to the zone in hopes of getting a real scoop. Unfortunately for them, one of the reporters discovers that there's more than baby milk being made at the 'Baby Milk Factory'.

General Akhboob then captures the reporter, as well as all the remaining reporters in his country. It turns out that General Akhboob has been building an army of mutants and a stockpile of chemical weapons. He's also holding several American reporters and other civilians captive. It is up to the Doomsday Squad, composed of Captain Carnage (Player 1) and Major Mayhem (Player 2), to invade Akhboob's base, wipe out his forces, destroy the mutants, rescue all the hostages and capture Akhboob.

Along the way, Captain Carnage and Major Mayhem fight various mutants and monsters, a giant mutant cyborg named Orcus, and eventually General Ahkboob himself. Ahkboob transforms into several forms, including a series of three giant heads. After his defeat, he attempts to escape by releasing a swarm of copies, but is captured and executed by electric chair.

The Doomsday Squad then decides to take a military leave to the Midway Pleasure Domes, a grotesque amusement park. The player(s) can only access this area if they collected 220 keys during the game. It is strongly hinted at that if one collects every item in the Midway Pleasure Domes something special will happen, but this is impossible if not very near to impossible.

101283.name: Ultimate Arctic Thunder
101283.description:
User Summary

A sequel to Arctic Thunder with new tracks and vehicles. Race snow machines accross various tracks. Beat the time to continue.

videogame.70603: Brothers in Arms: Earned in Blood

101285.name: Brothers in Arms: Double Time

videogamecompilation.70603: Brothers in Arms: Earned in Blood

101285.description:
Play as Sergeant Matt Baker or Joe Hartsock, and lead your squad behind enemy lines through the Normandy invasion that will define history and unite you forever as brothers in arms.

Features

- 30+ playable levels: Brothers In Arms® Double Time combines the complete stories of the first two Brothers In Arms games. Fight through the D-Day invasion and the following days in Normandy.

- Unprecedented authenticity: Fight actual Airborne Infantry D-Day battles with historically accurate battlefields, events, and equipment recreated from Army Signal Corps photos, Aerial reconnaissance Imagery and eyewitness accounts.

- Real Military Tactics: Find, Fix, Flank, and finish your enemies like a real WWII Squad leader.

- Issue orders with the Wii Remote™: Commanding and leading your squad has never been more realistic.

Source: The Publisher Website.

101286.name: 2 Minute Drill
101286.description:
User Summary

2 Minute Drill is a combo action/arcade game. Play football and as part of the game, you actually get to throw a real football.

101287.description:
User Summary

A tennis game from Taito. Follows the standard rules of Tennis. View is 3/4 from one side of the court.

101288.name: Aa Eikou No Koushien
101288.description:
User Summary

A baseball game from Taito that plays like standard Baseball. You can charge up to hit the ball better.

101289.name: Acrobat
101289.description:
User Summary

Play circus people trying to bounce up on a trampoline and pop balloons.

101290.name: Air Inferno
101290.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "Air Inferno", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Air Inferno is a 1990 flight simulation video game published by Taito Corporation in North American territories.

101291.name: Akkanvader
101291.description:
User Summary

A modern remake of space invaders. Players join forces to repel advancing aliens.

101292.name: Asuka & Asuka
101292.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "Asuka & Asuka", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Asuka & Asuka is a vertically scrolling shoot 'em up arcade game released by Taito in 1988. The player controls a fighter jet and shoots enemies in the air and ground, collects power-ups, and defeats bosses to advance levels.

101293.name: Athlete
101293.description:
User Summary

A track and field sports game from Taito.

101294.name: Ball Park
101294.description:
User Summary

An early baseball game from Taito that follows normal baseball rules.

101295.name: Ball Park II
101295.description:
User Summary

A sequel to Ball Park, released the same year. Play baseball in this early color Taito game.

101296.name: Dragon's Dogma
101296.description:
During its raid on the fishing village of Casadeis a dragon approaches the hero of the story and tells him that he is the chosen one then proceeds to tear out his heart. With his heart torn out the hero’s death is inevitable but through unknown circumstances is reborn. Now revived as an 'enlightened one' he is destined to find and kill the dragon that stole his heart.

Set in a huge open world, Dragon's Dogma offers an exhilarating and fulfilling action combat game with the freedom to explore and interact in a rich, living and breathing world. Alongside your party of three, you set out to track down and destroy a mysterious dragon. Your teammates fight independently of you, demonstrating prowess and ability they have developed based on traits learned over time from you and your actions.

Accessible Depth: Bringing an unprecedented level of depth to the action genre, every decision has an effect on gameplay in an intuitive way that does not require micromanagement. The weight of your weapon, the material of your armor -- even the length of your legs -- plays a role in how you fight your battles, but does not interrupt the flow of the action.

Epic Adventure: Dragon's Dogma is built from the ground up as an action experience for consoles with a continuous, epic storyline that stands alone in style, scope and substance.

Open World: Utilizing Capcom's proprietary MT Framework engine and the groundbreaking graphical styles and lighting effects used in Resident Evil 5 and Lost Planet 2, Dragon's Dogma expands the environment to create a vast, richly detailed world, ripe for exploration.

Night and Day: The open world features a dynamic 24-hour day/night cycle that will offer different enemies and surprises depending on when you venture into the world.

Pawn Them All: The pawn system offers flexible combat assistance with main pawn companion that you can train throughout the game and two secondary pawns that can vary wildly to fit your combat style.

A Rich Population: In addition to interacting with hundreds of fully voiced NPCs, you'll be able to fight a large variety of creatures, from goblins to griffins and dragons. Each enemy requires a different strategy and provides a unique experience.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dragon's Dogma," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101298.name: Battle Gear
101298.description:
User Summary

A japanese Taito driving game. Race several different tracks with different vehicles.

101299.name: Unsolved Crimes
101299.description:
User Summary

The player takes the part of a young detective and attempts to solve several cases. They are matched with a partner and must investigate, find evidence, and solve the cases. Multiple choice questions must be answered to proceed, and failure causes your partner to distrust you. If you lose too much trust the game will end.

101300.name: Buck Fever
101300.description:
Arcade Hunting:

Buck Fever brings the familiar “point and shoot” arcade action home to your living room. Instead of stalking your target you immediately get into the hunt and start shooting. Choose a region on the in-game Hunting Map (such as Western, Central, Eastern, Southern, and Southwestern United States, and four Canadian provinces) and compete for the top seat on the in-game High Score leaderboard. Buck Fever supports Nintendo’s Wii Zapper accessory.

Multiplayer Party Mode

One to four players can join in on a hunt simultaneously. Buck Fever features two unique multiplayer “party” modes: Hunter’s Challenge and Bonus Games. In the Hunter’s Challenge one to four players compete within a time limit for the highest score. In six Bonus Games one to four players compete in a timed shoot-out with inanimate objects (such as bottles and cans) or animal targets such as gopher and duck.

Trophy Room:

Buck Fever features a Trophy Room that, per player, shows off the diverse wildlife you’ve bagged in the game’s 70 hunts including, but not limited to, desert mule, blacktail, fallow, mule, and whitetail deer, and wild boar. The Trophy Room also displays how many bucks you have hunted, the number of one-shot kills you have earned, the biggest buck you’ve brought down, and the highest overall score achieved while playing the game.

Source: The Developer Website.

101301.name: American Popstar: Road to Celebrity
101301.description:
This is your enthralling and interactive success story as a young hopeful in the music milieu. The adventure begins when you get the chance to audition at you Hollywood high school. But the road to celebrity is not a highway: your secret crush is also auditioning, and so is your evil rival. This unique mix of social adventure and music game will let you meet lots of people who may help you build your career, show your talent skills to the world, and take your best photo with the camera to the delight of your fans. You're about to be the greatest pop star in the world! Talk, share activities, and be friendly or unfriendly with numerous characters! Customize your character's name and appearance, and develop skills through your actions. Four musical mini games: Guitar, Singing, Drums and Dance. Record your voice, take your own photos and sign autographs! Two multiplayer modes for 2-4 players.

Source: The Publisher Website.

101302.name: Bomberman Blitz
101302.description:
Source: The Publisher Website.

Bomberman makes his debut downloadable appearance on Nintendo DSiWare with Bomberman Blitz! Experience the classic Bomberman multiplayer experience with 8 local and online multiplayer through Nintendo Wi-Fi connection. Hone your skills and learn the maps and when ready, take the battle online! Change multiple map and item preferences and tons of customization options to battle it out. Delivering unparalleled multiplayer gaming excitement, Bomberman Blitz giver everyone who picks up Nintendo DSi system the addctive fun of Bomberman, anytime, anywhere! Bring Friends!

101303.name: Joe Cable
101303.description:
Meet “Joe Cable”; a clumsy power line technician... Not only is Joe afraid of heights, he also finds himself dangling on a power line every now and then when his ladder slips away on a average day of work! Quickly being able to grab and wrap his belt around one of the power cords he notices the danger has only just begun when he starts sliding and making some actual speed!

"Joe Cable" is a fast paced arcade game for the Apple iPhone and iPod Touch. The game focusses on quick movement and reflexes to help “Joe” dodge as many incoming objects as possible while he slides down a power cord!

Can you help "Joe" to hang on and avoid even more danger?

Source: The Game Website.

101304.name: Cubo
101304.description:
Got good memory? Prove it! ...with Cubo!

Cubo is a blazing fast puzzle game for iPhone, iPad and iPod Touch! Memorize and repeat sequences of colors to advance in level. The game is quite similar to the good old and popular 'board game' “Simon Says”. The player who can remember and repeat the longest sequence of colors will get the highest score.

SOLVE COMPLEX PUZZLES
Feel the tension as you focus on solving the most complex Cubo color chains! Focus on sounds, rhythm and colors to get as far as you can.

TRAIN YOUR BRAIN
Your short term memory will greatly improve as you put it to the test in Cubo! Try to achieve the highest level possible in this challenging and addicting puzzle game!

INNOVATIVE CONTROLS
Simple and effective touch controls will allow you to 'pick up and play'! Cubo can be played in any quick spare minute and is controlled through a clean and clear interface using only 4 buttons!

STYLISH GRAPHICS
Cubo comes with stylish artwork and makes full use of the amazing "Retina Display" and larger iPad screen! It also comes as a universal app for all devices as a single download!

Source: The Game Website.

101306.name: Battle Fantasia
101306.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "Battle Fantasia", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Battle Fantasia (バトルファンタジア, Batoru Fantajia?) is a fighting video game developed by Arc System Works. Originally released in Japanese arcades in April 2007, the title was ported to the Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3 home consoles in Japan in May 2008, with a North American Xbox 360-exclusive version released in English in September 2008 by Aksys Games. It was later released in Europe in March 2009 for both systems by 505 Games. The game's development was headed by Emiko Iwasaki, who had previously served as illustrator for the company's Guilty Gear series, and utilizes three-dimensional character models restricted to two-dimensional battlefields. Battle Fantasia retains a number of features of its predecessor including fast-paced gameplay, colorful anime-style graphics, and over-the-top effects, yet was designed to be a more basic representation of the fighting genre.

The game is notable for its stylistic departure from many fighting games, and is set in a fantasy world depicted as a storybook, and borrows many superficial elements from role-playing games including damage represented as numbers and a text-heavy story mode, which involves a number of heroes answering the call to battle to stop an evil force from once again attempting to destroy the world. Battle Fantasia met with relatively low sales in Japan and received mostly average reviews from critics due the title's minimal marketing and lack of robust console features.

101307.name: The Legend of Wolfgang von Horn
101307.description:
Writer Blurb:

This adventure is written for the WFRP Scenario Competition 2007. It features a not so pious Templar of Ulric, some history of the times of Magnus the Pious, and a horde of beastmen as antagonists.

I tried to create an adventure that lives up to the ‘grim and perilous’ reputation of the game. The scenario won’t leave the PCs unaffected, as they are heading for a battle in which they and all their companions will die, brutally, violently and repeatedly - and they know it, and cannot avoid it.

In game terms, the PCs will end up with at least a couple of insanity points each - the longer they take in solving the scenario, the more insanity points they will gather. This is offset by the chance to gain a fate point at the end of the adventure.

101308.name: Battle Gear 2
101308.description:
User Summary

Part of the Battle Gear series. This is the second version with new tracks and vehicles.

101309.name: Battle Gear 3
101309.description:
User Summary

The third release of the Battle Gear Series. Offers 33 cars and six tracks.

101310.name: Battle Gear 4 Tuned
101310.description:
User Summary

The forth game in the Battle Gear series. Offers more cars and tracks with updated graphics.

101311.name: Battle Lane Vol. 5
101311.description:
User Summary

A motorcycle racing/battle game. Fight and race your way through 6 stages blowing up enemies and trying to destroy the enemy bases secret weapon.

101312.name: Ben Bero Beh
101312.description:
User Summary

A cutsy platform game from Taito. Lead your anime type character through buildings. Weird monsters and other obstacles await you from closed doors. Try to make it through each level to advance to others.

101313.name: Big Event Golf
101313.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "Big Event Golf", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Big Event Golf is a golf arcade game released by Taito in 1986. You play a 18 hole championship course.

101314.name: The Nine Virtues of Magnus the Pious
101314.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Welcome to The Nine Virtues of Magnus the Pious, a WFRP scenario for players still in their first careers. It is ideal as a campaign opener, since it gives GM opportunity to bunch together PCs from all sorts of careers. If you are planning to run this adventure for more experienced players, all you need to do is accordingly adjust the strength of opposition.

The adventure takes place in the city of Wolfenburg during the first siege of Chaos led by warlord Surtha Lenk in the year 2521. It will take PCs on a quest through the streets of ravaged city, bring them face to face with the horrors of chaos and offer them possible salvation from the besieged city.

101315.name: Bio Attack
101315.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "Bio Attack", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Bio-Attack is a vertically scrolling shoot 'em up arcade game released by Taito in 1983. Here, you control a ship through a human's body while shooting viruses. It was licensed to Fox Video Games.

101316.name: The Oldenhaller Contract
101316.description:
2008 scenario competition finalist for second edition of WFRP run by Fantasy Flight Games.

Publisher Blurb:

Although The Oldenhaller Contract has been designed with beginners in mind some experienced role-players will also find it interesting and possibly useful as an introduction to the rules - and hopefully fun to play as well!

Alternatively this scenario could be run as part of the "Paths of the Damned" Campaign - the third book of which takes part in the city of Nuln. However this will require some juggling, as this scenario is set several years before the events detailed in that book. The scenario will act as a sideline from the campaign proper, and allow the Players to better get to know the City and make some important contacts which may prove very helpful, especially as this scenario and Paths of the Damned share many key None Player Characters (NPCs) and locations in common.

101317.name: Birdie King
101317.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "Birdie King", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Birdie King is a golf arcade game released in 1982 by Taito.

101318.name: Birdie King 2
101318.description:
User Summary

Second in the Birdie king series. New courses and graphics.

Source: Wikipedia, "Birdie King", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Birdie King is a golf arcade game released in 1982 by Taito.

101319.name: That Way Madness Lies!
101319.description:
Writer Blurb:

That Way Madness Lies! is a short adventure designed for characters in their first or second careers. The starting location of the adventure is intentionally vague and the rudiments straightforward: One of the characters should be moderately wounded from battle and keen for treatment.

2007 scenario contest

101320.name: Birdie King 3
101320.description:
User Summary

The third in the Birdie King series with new courses and new graphics.

Source: Wikipedia, "Birdie King", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Birdie King is a golf arcade game released by Taito.

101322.name: Buggy Challenge
101322.description:
User Summary

Drive a dune buggy over many obstacles through a track. Try to complete all four races without running out of gas.

101323.name: Cachat
101323.description:
User Summary

A puzzle drop game where you need to line up pipe-like electrode channels to make blocks disappear. Has Competitive play.

101324.name: Champion Wrestler
101324.description:
User Summary

A wrestling game from Taito. Practice your pro-wrestling moves to pin your opponent.

101325.name: Change Lanes
101325.description:
User Summary

A driving game from Taito. Has simple graphics and play style. Try to meet the allotted time to get more play.

101326.name: Chaos Heat
101326.description:
User Summary

A collaborative shoot-em up. Work together to kill zombies in a lab. Try to shoot your way out to escape.

101327.name: A Bitter Harvest
101327.description:
Publisher blurb:

A Bitter Harvest is designed for 3-6 characters in their second careers, although the difficulty level can be changed for groups of other sizes and experience levels. It can be run independently or inserted into an existing campaign. It is a rural adventure, involving social interaction amongst commoners, outdoors travel and some magic. A party without stealth skills will have a very hard time. Familiarity with Greenskins and someone with Magical Sense would help but are by no means necessary. Careful roleplayers can complete the adventure with only one easy combat. Clumsy ones and/or PCs with an overwhelming hatred of Goblinoids (e.g. an uncontrollably deranged Trollslayer) will find themselves losing Fate Points in a full-scale battle. While most kinds of characters will have something to contribute, very urban-focussed or upper-class characters will need careful roleplaying and gamesmastering.

The adventure can take place in any hilly area within a day’s travel of a town on a major river, although if the campaign is set after the Storm of Chaos it should be placed towards the West and South of the Empire where the economy is relatively undisturbed. It takes place in late summer or early autumn. The players will need to show initiative to get the most out of the adventure. The first part is linear, but with numerous roleplaying opportunities during which the PCs can learn what is going on. What they discover will then inform their decisions in the much more open conclusion. Completion should take 2-4 sessions (8-16 hours of play).

101328.name: Chase Bombers
101328.description:
User Summary

Another race game from Taito. Race against opponents. Try to avoid running off the track or hitting other cars. Meet time limits to continue play.

101329.name: Chase Bombers
101329.description:
User Summary

A cutesy shootem up. Play a flying monk and shoot various big eyed beasties to complete levels.

101330.name: Cleopatra Fortune
101330.description:
User Summary

A puzzle drop game with an animated Egyptian theme.

101331.name: Cycle Shooting
101331.description:
User Summary

A shooter where you shoot at motorcycles that drive back and forth across the screen.

101332.description:
Hello Kitty Muffinsspelet (Swedish. English translation: Hello Kitty The Cupcake game)

Game components:

Game Board,
4 Hello Kitty playing pieces,
1 6-sided die,
20 cupcake counters
4 Hello Kitty counters
4 Hello Kitty and Daisy counters
4 treat tokens
1 rulebook

The basic idea of the the game is to roll the die and move around the edge of the board where the counters are laid out. When you land on a counter you flip it over and either take an action or keep it, depending on what the counter shows. The goal is to collect 4 of the same kind of cupcake and then move to one of the cupcakes depicted in the center of the board and put a treat token on top. The first player to do this wins the game.
101332.name: Hello Kitty Muffinsspelet

101333.name: Laser Squid Nemesis
101333.description:
From Back of Module

Lasers! Squids!
Nemesises? Nemesi? Nemesissies? Nemewhatsis?
More than one Nemesis!

Take a plunge with the C-Team as they fight not just one nemesis, but a whole school - including The Codfather, Fin Diesel, Charlie's Angelfish and a platter full of other nefarious ne'er-do-wells.

Play as squids, octopi and other sea creatures, armed with deadly lazers, dazers, phazers and possibly other -azers in this light-hearted game that's too full of fish shticks to know it's all wet.

Inspired by a Penny-Arcade.com Comic Strip

101334.name: Athlete Kings
101334.description:
Back of the Box
Join 8 International Olympic athletes as they compete in 10 decathlon disciplines. You never thought running, jumping and throwing could be such fun - in a brilliantly quirky AM3 conversion that brings steel-hard competition to the home.

101335.name: Scrabble DASH
101335.description:
Description from the back of the box:

"Scrabble DASH is the fun, fast-paced word game with cards. Use your letter cards to make a word that can match what the Dash card says and put your cards on the table. It's that simple. But everyone's racing against you to get their word down first so move fast!"

Components:

This game is entirely card-based, consisting of 38 vowel cards, 48 consonant cards, and 19 "Dash" cards.

Gameplay summary:

Each player has a hand of 7 letter cards - initially 5 consonants and 2 vowels, but as the game progresses players can refill their hands freely from the separate vowel and consonant decks to vary the mix.

On each turn, the top Dash card is turned face up, revealing the goal for that turn. Players then race to play a word from their hands to fulfil the Dash card, or skip the turn to discard cards and draw new ones.

The Dash cards include criteria such as number of letters (ranging from 2 to 4), specific parts of speech (verb/proper noun), or specifying that the word has to start, end with, or contain a particular letter, drawn at random from either the vowel or consonant deck (players do not need to play their own copy of this letter from their hand).

The first player to lay down a valid word claims the Dash card, and the first player to collect 5 Dash cards wins the game.

101336.name: Soul Fighter
101336.description:
Back of the Box
Soul Fighter is a free roaming real-time 3D beat-em-up based in a medieval setting...that offers you a choice between Arcade Mode and Adventure Mode. You select to play one of three characters: Atlus, Sayomi or Orion, each with its own strengths and weakness and each offering over 100 distinctly different motion capture moves.

You fight against 44 half-human, half-beast enemies across 5 worlds, spanning 12 levels to save the kingdom of Gomar from its evil spell...

As you journey throughout the levels you learn to master the fighting techniques and combo systems in preparation for the showdown the respective end of world bosses. You must search for energy pick ups, magic, gold and the many hidden long range weapons, which enable you to play in first person perspective mode.

101337.name: Asura's Wrath
101337.description:
Once a revered deity, Asura was betrayed by his fellow gods and stripped of all his powers. Consumed by anger at the injustice he has suffered and swearing to seek vengeance and save his daughter Mithra from the Seven Deities who usurps her powers, Asura discovers he can use this fury to his advantage and turn it against his enemies. Cue relentless action as Asura finds himself facing off against numerous unique enemies, including planetary sized bosses, unleashing devastating and visceral attacks.

Source: Wikipedia, "Asura's Wrath," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101338.name: Sorcery (2012)
101338.description:
Players take the role of a young sorcerer's apprentice and must master the arcane arts in order to protect his homeland. The Nightmare Queen has broken the ancient pact with mankind and threatens to cover the land in eternal night, sending her foul minions across the land. Players must travel through the dark Faerie Kingdoms to save the land from the darkness that has enshrouded it. The world is based on Irish mythology and tradition.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sorcery (video game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101339.name: Midway Arcade Treasures Deluxe Edition
101339.description:
From Wikipedia: Midway Arcade Treasures Deluxe Edition is an arcade compilation. It is a compilation of Midway Arcade Treasures 2 and Midway Arcade Treasures 3, which had both been previously released on consoles only. Unlike the previous two volumes, it includes the original Mortal Kombat.

The 28 games included:
APB
Arch Rivals
Badlands
Championship Sprint
Cyberball 2072
Gauntlet II
Hard Drivin’
Kozmik Krooz’r
Hydro Thunder
Mortal Kombat
Mortal Kombat II
Mortal Kombat 3
NARC
Offroad Thunder
Pit-Fighter
Primal Rage
Race Drivin
Rampage World Tour
San Francisco Rush 2049
San Francisco Rush the Rock: Alcatraz Edition
S.T.U.N. Runner
Super Off Road with bonus Track-Pak
Timber
Total Carnage
Wacko
Wizard of Wor
Xenophobe
Xybots

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Midway_Arcade_Treasures_Deluxe_...; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101340.name: Viewtiful Joe: Double Trouble!
101340.description:
Viewtiful Joe: Double Trouble!, known is Japan as Viewtiful Joe: Scratch! (ビューティフル ジョー スクラッチ！ Byūtifuru Jō: Sukuracchi!?), is a video game developed by Clover Studio and published by Capcom for the Nintendo DS. It was released in 2005 in Japan and North America. Capcom partnered with Nintendo to distribute the game in Europe and Australia in early 2006. Viewtiful Joe: Double Trouble! is the fourth game released in the Viewtiful Joe series. The game's story opens on the set of director Captain Blue's new action movie in an amusement park called Movieland. When a mysterious group of villains known as Madow steal the only copy of the film, the superhero Viewtiful Joe and his younger sister Jasmine quickly give chase.

Gameplay in Viewtiful Joe: Double Trouble! is a mix of the platforming and beat 'em up video game genres. The DS touchscreen is a key feature of the game's controls, enabling players to utilize Viewtiful Joe's unique VFX powers in order to battle enemies and solve puzzles. These include being able to split the level in half horizontally or to swap the top screen to the touchscreen and vice versa. The game was relatively well received by critics, but it sold poorly.

Source: Wikipedia, "Viewtiful Joe: Double Trouble!", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101341.name: Ultimate Band
101341.description:
Ultimate Band allows players to play guitar, drums, bass or be the front man or woman in a band (though vocals are not supported). The Wii version follows the fortunes of an upstart rock band, with the player building the career of their customizable character, unlocking bonus songs, venues and accessories.

Ultimate Band forgoes the use of specialized peripherals such as guitar and drum controllers, relying mainly on the Wii Remote and Nunchuk for the Wii version, and the touch screen and stylus for the DS version. For example, to play notes on guitar in the Wii version the player must press a button combination on the Nunchuk while strumming the Wii Remote up and down. The DS version, based on Hannah Montana: Music Jam's code base, will also allow players to create and record their own songs, and have greater song customization options.

Ultimate Band features support for Disney Interactive's DGamer community network. The game will also feature connectivity between the Wii and DS versions, with DS players being able to control stage lighting and effects using the touch screen while a band performs on the Wii.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ultimate Band", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101342.name: Austin Powers Pinball
101342.description:
Austin Powers Pinball is a pinball-based video game. The game is thematically based on the Austin Powers series of films. In this game, there are two pinball games to play. One for the original movie: Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery and one for the second movie: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Austin_Powers_Pinball,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101343.name: RPG Snake: The Adventure of Akua
101343.description:
The classic snake game has returned in RPG form! Quest to save the pretty princess from the Devil! Destroy slime, sand worms, the undead, and more! Go save the damsel in distress. This is your ultimate mission.

Go now, Sir Knight. Fulfill your destiny!

Source: The Developer Website.

101344.name: Pucca's Restaurant
101344.description:
The success of your restaurant depends on your creative management skills! Begin as a small time chef in a gourmet restaurant and work your way up to becoming the head chef of a top-class restaurant.

- Enlist in the world’s best restaurant guide book to gain greater reputation!

- Design and customize your dream restaurant to show off to your friends.

- Keep your customers satisfied through aesthetic decorations and service mouth-watering dishes.

- Raise the standard of your restaurant through our FREE regular content updates!

Source: The Developer Website.

101345.name: A.R.E.S.: Extinction Agenda
101345.description:
User Summary

A.R.E.S.: Extinction Agenda an action-platform game. Set in an alternate future, it's the first chapter of its series. It features five stages, two difficulty levels, various weapons and power ups and a simple crafting system that allows the player to level up weapons and create consumables.

101346.name: Manic Digger
101346.description:
Manic Digger is the Free sandbox in which you build cities, trade with other players, plunder them and even kill. In game is a lot of content. You can build all that you want in this game. Whole cities are under construction for no reason other then the supply of wood and a stone. Cities-locks constructed in an environment of natural barriers and even, fortifications from brick walls. All what you will face in game is constructed by players.

Source: The Developer Website.

101347.name: Hannah Montana: Music Jam
101347.description:
Hannah Montana: Music Jam was released on November 7, 2007 in North America and on May 29, 2008 in Europe. The game lets you create your own songs, make music videos, and show it to other players. Players are able to link Nintendo DS systems over short-range wireless to form live "instrument" bands.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hannah Montana: Pop Star Exclusive", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101348.name: American McGee's Grimm: Episode 12 – Cinderella
101348.description:
This timeless story tells of the struggles of the young girl, Cinderella, as she strives for her "happily ever after". However, Grimm feels that something needs to change when Mrs. Angry Stepmother and the Evil Stepsisters don't get what's coming to them! Dance the night away with Cinderella through her old village, the town graveyard, Cinderella's new home, her new town, the new town graveyard, the prince's castle, and Cinderella's wedding (complete with explosive cake!). Yet another disturbing work, in the style a la Grimm!

Source: Wikipedia, "American McGee's Grimm", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101349.name: Dino Rex
101349.description:
User Summary

A fighting game where you play dinosaurs with little human masters. Use claws and biting moves to kill the other opponent.At the end, the loser gets eaten.

101350.name: All About Syracuse
101350.description:
The object of the game is for players to travel on the gameboard to the locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to their residence with the travel cards for all locations contained on their shopping list wins the game!

The board is made up of 6 oversized jigsaw puzzle pieces. It shows local businesses that players must travel to via the streets and highways. Spaces with question marks indicate a player must draw a Surprise card. Players must travel to the places on their shopping lists and return to their residence to win the game.

101351.name: Don Doko Don
101351.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "Don Doko Don", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

The players are bearded dwarves who must defeat various enemies by using a mallet to stun them. Players can pick stunned enemies up and throw them at other enemies to destroy them. Destroyed enemies leave behind fruit which can be collected for points. Once all enemies are destroyed play proceeds to the next level which is generally more difficult.

Throughout the game, various power-ups can be collected, which represent potions, hammers, or books help the players' character speed up, receive more power, or kill in different ways. In certain screens various secret levels can be accessed.

101352.name: Don Doko Don 2
101352.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "Don Doko Don 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Don Doko Don 2 is a side-scrolling 2D platformer game, developed and published by Taito Corporation, which was released in Japan in 1992. Pirated versions of this sequel have been labeled with names like "Mario 8" and "Super Bros. 8".

101354.name: Dangerous Curves
101354.description:
User Summary

Dangerous Curves is a two person race game. You can play a motorcycle or a car. On the cabinet, it has a motorcycle seat and a regular driving seat attached. Play through multiple tracks.

101355.name: DarkMist
101355.description:
User Summary

A scrolling game where you play a knight battling evil forces. Use collected power ups to increase shot power and heal. Defeat bosses at the end of levels to progress.

101356.name: Dynamite League
101356.description:
User Summary

A late '80s Tatio Baseball game. Play head to head using standard baseball rules.

101358.name: Euro Champ '92
101358.description:
User Summary

A soccer game from Taito. Allows for super kicks on goal. Follows standard international soccer rules.

101359.name: Euro Football Champ
101359.description:
User Summary

A 1990 Taito soccer game. Follows standard International rules for soccer. Pass the ball around and try to score goals.

101360.name: Field Goal
101360.description:
User Summary

Use a paddle and buttons to try to make field goals. Each successful kick puts your farther away from the goal posts.

101361.name: Fighters' Impact
101361.description:
User Summary

A 3d fighting game from Taito. Play different characters and use special moves to beat up the other player.

101362.name: Fighters' Impact A
101362.description:
User Summary

A sequel to Fighters' Impact. This is another 3d fighing game with updated moves and characters. Use special moves and martial arts to dispatch you opponents.

101363.name: Fighting Gate
101363.description:
User Summary

A two player horse racing game. Try to get the best start out of the gate. Pace yourself and push your horse at the optimal time to pull out the win.

101364.name: Fighting Hawk
101364.description:
User Summary

A 1-2 player flying shooting game. Fly planes, collect power-ups and destroy enemies. Collect bombs to drop on the enemies and bosses. Collect power-ups to give you seeking missiles to help you progress through levels.

101365.name: Fighting Roller
101365.description:
User Summary

Race down a track on rollerskates. Try to avoid obstacles and other skaters to win the race.

101366.name: The Fighting
101366.description:
User Summary

A head to head boxing game with very animated graphics. Use different punches and blocks to try to knock out your opponent while not getting knocked out.

101367.name: Fire Battle
101367.description:
User Summary

A vertical scroller shooting game where you play a futuristic ship that fires bullets and drops specifically targetted bombs. Playstyle is very similar to Xevious.

101368.name: Fitter
101368.description:
User Summary

A maze game where you collect colored blocks to match their repsective spots on the board. Change your color to match them and score points while completing levels. Avoid enemies which try to eat you.

101369.name: I Luv London
101369.description:
Localized version of the popular family board game Monopoly.
Players roll the dice and move around the (Canadian city!) London buying properties and trading.

101370.name: Flip Maze
101370.description:
User Summary

An odd puzzle game from Taito. Involves very cutesy animals and pink rabbits.

101371.name: Flying Fortress II
101371.description:
User Summary

A black and white sequel to Flying Fortress. Play is similar to Canyon Bomber. Drop bombs from your flying B-17 bomber on targets with points.

101372.name: Flying Shark
101372.description:
User Summary

Play WWI flying planes in this Taito Shoot 'em up. Collect powerups to increase firepower. Drop bombs to do maximum damage and save yourself from oncoming bullets. Destroy bosses to advance to other levels.

101373.name: Frog & Spiders
101373.description:
User Summary

Play a frog. Jump around webs and eat spiders. Don't fall off!

101374.name: Galactic Storm
101374.description:
User Summary

A very cool Shoot 'em up from Taito. Uses a chase view to show you shooting other enemies and advancing in the game. Taito brings a different take to the shooters of the day which were primarily an overhead view.

101376.name: Ganbare Untenshi
101376.description:
User Summary

An odd Taito Japanese release game where you drive a rail car accross Japan. Try not to run over anyone too important. Uses real video in sections.

101377.name: Gang Hunter
101377.description:
User Summary

A shooting game from Taito. Use an attached positional pistol to shoot gangsters from level to level. Clear screens of bad guys to advance.

101378.name: Gekirindan
101378.description:
User Summary

A very colorful scrolling shoot 'em up from Taito. Fly futuristic ships, collect power-ups, drop bombs, destroy enemies and bosses while advancing through levels.

101379.name: Get Star
101379.description:
User Summary

In this fighting scroller, you beat up enemies across multiple planets. Defeat the bosses at the end of each strange world. Clear all the worlds to win the game.

101380.name: Global Champion
101380.description:
User Summary

Another head to head fighting game from Taito. Play one of several different characters with different fighting styles, speeds and special moves. Defeat opponents to progress in single player.

101381.name: Go For The Gold
101381.description:
User Summary

Play through multiple Olympic events and try to take the gold! You have to get certain levels or times met in each event to progress.

101382.name: Go Go Mr. Yamaguchi
101382.description:
User Summary

Scroll through multiple levels as you play the explorer Mr. Yamaguchi who has no trouble shooting natives and animals to stay alive while he explores the jungle.

101384.name: Golgo 13
101384.description:
User Summary

This game is based off the popular adult animated series of the same name. Play through many different types of levels. Drive, fly and shoot your way to the end.

101385.name: Grand Champion
101385.description:
User Summary

A vertical driving game from taito. Attempt to finish levels before running out of time. Try to avoid hitting other cars or running off the road.

101386.name: Grid Seeker: Project Storm Hammer
101386.description:
User Summary

An overhead view scrolling shoot 'em up. Play modern jet fighters. Collect power ups and bombs to increase fire power. Beat bosses to progress through levels.

101387.name: Build-a-Bear Workshop: A Friend Fur All Seasons
101387.description:
Story :

Build-A-Bear Workshop® A Friend Fur All Seasons Create and customize your furry friend then embarke on a sea-borne adventure to reach

Your furry friend is invited to a great party at the Castle Island by Bearemy and Pawlette. In order to cross the sea and reach the party, Bearemy and Pawlette offer you the Friend Ship. Explore new islands on the way and take time to meet and interact with the furry friends that live there. They love playing games too, so on each island you get to play mini games, help them out, and find the puzzle pieces needed to recreate the map that will lead you to the next island. Finally you reach the Castle Island where a big party awaits you!

Features :

- 2 different game modes! Discover and explore the 4 season-themed islands in the Adventure mode and play lots of fun mini-games in the Playground mode.

- 20 fun mini-games to play including ice skating, build a snowman, a croquet party, a cool ride on a ladybug, throwing a Frisbee, and jumping on a jump stick. Some of the mini-games contain surprises too..

- Play the mini-games as single or multiplayer party games (co-op) with up to 4 players – it’s fun for the whole family!

- Find the 6 secret treasure spots hidden around the islands and dig up a magic chest with a surprise just for you!

- Collect bear medals, other rewards and items to use in the Build-A-Bear Workshop. Choose from more than 80 items available to buy for your furry friend!

- Natural and innovative game play that take full advantage of the unique features of the Nintendo Wii

Source: The Developer Website.

101388.name: Gunbuster
101388.description:
User Summary

A four person, first person shooter. Use positional Uzis to shoot futuristic bad guys.

101389.name: Gun Lock
101389.description:
User Summary

A scrolling shoot 'em up from Taito. Collect power-ups and bombs to destroy enemies. This ship's secondary weapon locks on targets to blow them up.

101390.name: Gyrodine
101390.description:
User Summary

A scrolling one player shoot 'em up. Fly a helicopter and shoot down other enemies. Try not to get shot so you can advance from other levels.

101391.name: HλLF-LIFE² Survivor
101391.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "Half-Life 2: Survivor", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Half-Life 2: Survivor is an arcade game based on the science fiction first-person shooter video game, Half-Life 2. It was released on June 28, 2006 on Taito's Type X+ arcade system, with a 32" widescreen high definition LCD running at 1360x768 resolution. The game's player character is controlled with joysticks and floor pedals, and offers three game modes: Story, Battle, and Mission, each with different objectives. The game was met with a generally positive reception. Reviewers found it interesting to play the game in an arcade environment, and considered the shift to an arcade setting an excellent introduction of the Half-Life series of video games to Japan.

101392.name: Formation Z
101392.description:
Formation Z (フォーメーションZ?) is a side-scrolling shoot 'em up video game initially released in arcades in 1984 by Jaleco. The arcade release was distributed by Williams and known as Aeroboto outside of Japan. It was later ported to the MSX and to the Famicom, the latter being included as part of Jaleco Collection Vol. 1 for the PlayStation. More recently the Famicom version of the game was made downloadable via the Wii's Virtual Console download service in Japan.

Taking place in the year 2701, the player controls a robot which can transform into an aero fighter on a mission to stop an alien super weapon from reaching the Earth. The robot may move forwards, backwards and jump, and the aero fighter may travel anywhere on screen but has limited fuel in which to do so. A combination of the two must be used to avoid obstacles, as well as to destroy any on-screen enemies for extra points.

Source: Wikipedia, "Formation Z", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101393.name: Hard Puncher
101393.description:
User Summary

An unusual boxing game from Taito. In this game you actually wear real boxing gloves and punch a pad as you play the game.

101394.name: Hat Trick Hero
101394.description:
User Summary

A competitive world cup soccer game. You have to defeat other teams in a time limit to progress.

101395.name: Hat Trick Hero '93
101395.description:
User Summary

A sequel to Hat Trick Hero. Play world cup soccer by international rules.

101396.name: Hat Trick Hero '94
101396.description:
User Summary

The third game in the Hat Trick Hero series. Play world cup soccer against teams of the time. Win by scoring more goals in a set time period.

101397.name: Hat Trick Hero '95
101397.description:
User Summary

The forth release in the Hat Trick Hero series. Play soccer by standard rules except it has a time limit. Outscore your oppponents to progress.

101398.name: Takeshi no Chōsenjō
101398.description:
Takeshi no Chōsenjō (たけしの挑戦状 Takeshi's Challenge?) is a Japanese action-adventure video game for the Family Computer (known internationally as the Nintendo Entertainment System) developed by the Taito Corporation. The game was developed under the direction of comedian-turned actor and film director Takeshi Kitano (Beat Takeshi), and was only released in Japan on December 10, 1986; according to a Taito Corporation source, 80,000 copies were sold.

Kitano incorporated many of his unique and controversial ideas into the game. For instance, the player can beat up a yakuza gangster at a pachinko gambling establishment, and take the yakuza's money to exchange for prizes. The player can use a hang-glider to fly over into a strange land called the "Red Country" (an amalgam between the Soviet Union and Nazi Germany). The player can gain access to the Red Country if they pass over the four other islands, but a huge mountain blocks the way into the country, and the player will be forced to crash into either the mountain or the ground, resulting in an automatic game over screen. There is also a choice on the password-entry screen ("Punch the old man") which also results in an automatic game over, even when the player has not even started the game. Other in-game events include: a game over screen where the player's character is given a funeral, singing karaoke at a pub (using the second-controller's built-in microphone), the main character divorcing his wife and paying a settlement, beating up yakuza, or seeing inhumane comments on store signs.

Source: Wikipedia, "Takeshi no Chōsenjō", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101399.name: Heavy Unit
101399.description:
User Summary

In this horizontal shoot 'em up, use your gun to shoot many ugly aliens to progress from level to level. Shoot up bosses at the end of each phase.

101400.name: High Way Race
101400.description:
User Summary

A very simple racing game. Dodge cars, jump over water and use brakes when necessary. Beat the clock to progress.

101401.name: Indian Battle
101401.description:
User Summary

A western themed Taito game. Cowboys and Indians battle in the desert.

101402.name: Insector X
101402.description:
User Summary

Shoot bees and bosses in this very cutesy, cartoon-like scrolling shoot'em up. Collect powerups and try to

101403.name: Inspiration Baseball
101403.description:
User Summary

A baseball game from Taito. Play against your opponent. Try to get more hits and runs to win.

101404.name: Interceptor
101404.description:
User Summary

Play a Space fighter and shoot down other fighters in this old arcade game.

101405.name: Joshi Volleyball
101405.description:
User Summary

A volleyball game from Taito. Play using standard rules with very simplified graphics.

101406.name: Kick And Run
101406.description:
User Summary

Another soccer game from Taito. Simple but fun graphics. Play single player or head to head.

101407.name: Kick Start
101407.description:
User Summary

A motorcycle racing game. The graphics are simple. Race against time and computer opponents.

101408.name: Knight Boy
101408.description:
User Summary

A platform game by Taito. Kill zombies, ghosts and other undead. Progress from increasingly difficult and different levels.

101409.name: Kram
101409.description:
User Summary

Control your character Kram. Try to build walls fast so the enemies don't get you. Sometimes you have to destroy your own walls to get ahead.

101410.name: L.S.A. Squad
101410.description:
User Summary

Play military men who drive tanks, planes and ships to shoot enemies and progress through levels.

101411.name: Land Maker
101411.description:
User Summary

A puzzle game where you put colored blocks together to form land faster than your opponent.

101412.name: Landing Gear
101412.description:
User Summary

A fairly well done flight simulation game. This is an unusual game for arcades in that there is no combat.

101413.name: American McGee's Grimm: Episode 13 – The Golden Goose
101413.description:
When the youngest of three brothers earns a goose of pure gold for being nice to a stranger, he ends up with more rewards than he first thought! Time for Doctor Grimm to "cure" this epidemic! Follow the youngest brother's quest as he heads through his small hut, the local woods, the nearby town, the castle's wine cellar, Mount Bread, and the ship that sails on land and sea! May your voyage be merry aboard the S.S. Grimm!

Source: Wikipedia, "American McGee's Grimm", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgamehonor.22603: 2011 Ludo Award Best Board Game Popular Winner

101414.description:
Birds are envied by humans and watched since dawn of history. Birding is one of the greatest hobbies in the world. In this game, you are a bird photographer, competing to get the more precious photo collection of Brazilian birds by travelling through all the regions of the Brazil.

Pássaros (Birds) is a light strategy game in which the players, as bird photographers, try to get the best photos of Brazilian birds while traveling in all Brazilian regions.

Pássaros has two game rules included, a basic rules, in that the players travel and take photos in any desired order. In the end, players receive points for the most different types of birds, for each three of a kind photos and also considering the resources they did not spent during the game.

In the advanced rules, players must travel first, and take photos later, also, the birds themselves fly all along the board. All points categories in basic play still counts, but also players get points for having the most photos in each categories.

The game is played in five rounds of three turns each, and during each round, the players are considered to be traveling, and the photos taken are in "unsecure" memory cards, that can be lost. Only at the end of each round the photos are downloaded to a secure server.
101414.name: Pássaros

101415.name: Build-a-Bear Workshop: Where Best Friends Are Made
101415.description:
Story :

Get ready for the total Build-A-Bear experience on Nintendo DS™! Make your own Build-A-Bear, dress it up, play with it in lots of funny activities and mini games! The Bear will be like a virtual extension of yourself and a personal companion you can love like a best friend. You must make sure you satisfy its daily needs as physical affection, fun, food, learning, social life and trendyness are all necessary elements for the Bear to be balanced and happy. A highly interactive and trans-generational game in the true Build-A-Bear spirit!

Create and customise your very own Bear in the Workshop-part of the game. Here you get to pick out the Bear you want, choose a motto, stuff it, insert its special heart and whisper a secret into its ear. Next you stitch it together, fluff it, name it, dress it and take it home to its special house that you get to colour for it. There are 8 different Bear characters you can customise: Dimples Teddy, Mocha Bunny, Pink Poodle, Playfull Puppy, Velvet Teddy, Friendly Frog, Marvelous Monkey, Sassy Kitty.

Build-A-Bear for Nintendo DS™ is a new, fun kind of relationship simulation game, which takes into account the Bear's evolution as much as the players' fun factor. The Build-A-Bear characters, graphical universe and lifestyles are respectfully adapted and enhanced by this new addition: the Virtual Bear, an extension of every Build-A-Bear fan around the world!

Features :

- Choose between more than a 100 different clothing items and accessories!

- Your Bear’s home is the interface itself and contains 6 different areas each hosting 2 to 4 unique activities including food preparation, dancing education, playing ground , tooth brushing, shopping and dressing up for a full photo sessions!

- Play 4 fun mini games – both single and multi player

- Trade clothing, accessories and pictures with your friends using the Wifi connection!

- Use the Nintendo DS™ microphone for whispering a wish and use the stylus for direct physical contact with your new beary best friend!

Source: The Developer Website.

101416.name: To End All Wars & Chaos on Crete (Ubiquity)
101416.description:
from the webpage:

Welcome to a brave new world of Pulp action for the Ubiquity Roleplaying System!

Triple Ace Games presents the first instalment of Daring Tales of Adventure. Every month we will bring you new tales in which your heroes can explore ancient tombs, battle evil villains and discover new locales!

To kick start your pulp action the first Daring Tale has two adventures ready for you run! When a friend says he has important information he wants to discuss, you know it’s the start of something big! Nazi agents, deadly Amazonian flesh eating insects, a kidnapped reporter, and a daring raid on Washington D.C. are all in a day’s work for heroes who want To End All Wars!

A missing scientist, a villain with plans of becoming a king, ancient puzzles, a deadly maze, a mythical creature that is not all the legends say it is, and a book whose contents could spell the end of mankind all mean its Chaos on Crete!

Daring Tales of Adventure #1 marks the start of a new line of pulp adventures for the Ubiquity RPG. this adventure module is designed for beginner characters of low experience.

101417.name: Poker Carré
101417.description:
In Poker Carré, players add cards to a grid and try to create sequences of at least four numbers (e.g., 1-2-3-4), sets of at least three cards of the same suit, and sets of at least three cards of the same value.

Why is this difficult? The deck consists of 49 cards – seven suits of seven cards numbered 1-7 – and each player starts with a hand of four cards, while nine cards are randomly laid out in a 3x3 grid. On a turn, a player adds a card to the grid adjacent to at least one card already on the table, with the restriction that at least one of the adjacent cards must have a value exactly one higher or one lower than the card being played. That player then draws a replacement card. Once all the cards have been played, tally the points; the player with the highest score wins.

101418.name: Web of the Spider Cult (Ubiquity)
101418.description:
from the publisher webpage:

When you find a dead body in your house, especially one which belongs to a notable explorer, you know it’s not going to be an ordinary day. Web of the Spider Cult takes the heroes from the corridors and galleries of the Boston Museum, to the bayou of Louisiana, and onto the dark jungles of Mexico. There, amid the ruins of a centuries old temple, the adventurers face their greatest enemy so far in the adventures.

101419.description:
Alchemy Gothic Treasury
Vampire Hunter’s Roller-Dice Game

Object:
A two-player game, played in two turns.
Each player takes his turn to see who can be the most successful Vampire, roaming the night and attacking victims, before the Vampire Hunter eventually kills him.

Game Play:
In each turn, one player is the Vampire, while the other is the Vampire Hunter. When the Vampire is eventually killed, the players reverse roles for the second turn and the Vampire who finishes the best ‘score’ of victims, wins.
Each turn lasts as many nights as the Vampire can stay alive, with each die roll representing one night. The Vampire rolls first and notes his ‘score’. The Vampire Hunter then rolls to try to kill the Vampire or save his victims. This continues with the Vampire adding his score, until he is eventually killed.

The Vampire’s roller-die is marked with:
3 bats = 3 victims this night.
2 bats = 2 victims this night.
1 bat = 1 victim this night.
Sunrise = No victims caught on this night.
Fangs = Attacks the Vampire Hunter and wins two free nights, (without a Vampire Hunter die roll).
Coffin = Remains resting in Coffin for the night.

The Vampire Hunter’s roller-die is marked with:
Garlic = Saves (cancels) all Vampire victims this night.
Crucifix = Defends against, (cancels) Fangs.
Decapitation = Kills the Vampire, if not in his Coffin.
Stake = Kills the Vampire, if caught in his Coffin.
101419.name: Vampire Hunter's Roller-Dice Game

101420.name: Ninety-Nine
101420.description:
[This adding game is not to be confused with the trick-taking game, Ninety-Nine.]

From David Parlett's Penguin Encyclopedia of Card Games:

Said to be a Gypsy game. Deal three cards each and stack the rest face down. Play goes to the left, but may change. Each in turn plays a face up card to the table, announces the total value of all cards played so far, and draws a replacement from stock.

Cards count as follows:

2, 5, 6, 7, 8: Face value
Black Ace: Changes the total to 0-99, player's choice
Red Ace: 2
3, 4: 0
9: Changes the total to 99
10: -10
Jack: 10 and reverse direction of play
Queen, King: 10

The total may not exceed 99. The first player to be unable to play, loses a life. The first to lose three lives, loses the game.

101421.description:
Two promotional cards for the game MiniMonfa.

MiniMonFa is a 2-player, non-collectible card game that allows you to become an Archmage who must set up his dungeon in order to defend himself from the ongoing attacks of the local heroes, always covetous of glory, treasures, and experience points.

You have to build your dungeon with great mastery and shrewd strategy to stop the heroes: to achieve such a result, you can place insidious traps and unleash powerful and cunning creatures.

Besides defending your underground dwelling, you will have to lead the fearless heroes you recruited to get rid of the competing Archmage who is weakening your grip on the surrounding areas.

Defend your own dungeon and assail your enemy's! Will you find the way to manage both? Are you ready to try?

The two promotional cards add Rigor Mortis himself to the game, as well as a bunch of Goblin Henchmen for Rigor Mortis. Rigor Mortis has three new abilities (Henchmen; Deadly Gaze and Firephoenix), his goblin servants won't die, but instead flee back to your hand if the Rigor Mortis card is in play.
101421.name: MiniMonfa: 2 promo cards

101423.name: Burger Island
101423.description:
Description

As Patty Melton, the new owner of the tropical island-based Beach Burger restaurant, you must grill burgers, cook fries, and blend milkshakes all to order to earn money to spread your franchise all the way to the capital city of Honochuchu. Buy new recipes from the mysterious Tiki Guy, and watch your business erupt!

Features


Earn money and buy new recipes as you progress through the island.
60 levels of burger-flipping fun!
Three difficulty settings: Kiddie, Regular & Jumbo Size!
Over 30 different recipes to satisfy your hungry customers!
Build restaurants at five beautiful beachfront locations!


Source: The Developer Website.

101424.name: Q-Ball Billiards Master
101424.description:
Back of the box

Q-Ball Billiards Master is a pool player's dream, utilizing the power of the PlayStation 2 computer entertainment system to capture breathtakingly realistic gameplay in the most impressive pool halls in the world.

101425.name: Cucumber
101425.description:
From Dave Parlett's The Penguin Book of Card Games:

Called Gurka in Swedish and Ogórek in Polish, this Baltic gambling game may be played for either money or for a simple point-score.

Each player is dealt six cards, ranking upwards 23456789TJQKA. The aim is to avoid taking the last trick.

Each trick is led by the winner of the previous trick (the first trick is led by the player to the dealer's left). Each in turn must then play a card equal to or higher in rank than the previous card played. If they cannot, they then must play their lowest card. Whoever plays the highest card, or the last played if equally high, wins the trick.

Whoever wins the last trick scores penalty points equal to the face value of the card they won the trick with (as does anyone who played a card of the same rank), counting Ace 14, King 13, Queen 12, and Jack 11.

A player reaching 30 points is a "cucumber" and drops out of the game.

101426.name: Ninja Kid
101426.description:
Ninja-Kid, known in Japan as Ninja-kun Majō no Bōken (忍者くん魔城の冒険?), is the first video game in the Ninja-kun series. It was released for arcades, on the NES, and MSX by Jaleco in 1984.

Ninja-Kid features three upward scrolling levels that repeat and become more difficult.[1] The objective is to defeat the enemies on each screen and advance to the next screen. The player can attacks with shurikens and can jump on enemies' heads to stun them. Occasionally, an orb will appear and if the player collects three, a bonus level will be unlocked.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ninja-Kid", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101427.name: Ninja Kid II
101427.description:
Ninja-Kid II, known in Japan as Ninja-kun Ashura no Shō (忍者くん阿修羅の章?) and known in North America as Rad Action and JT-104, is a platform action arcade game first developed and published in 1987 by UPL in Japan. It is the direct sequel of Ninja-Kid.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ninja-Kid", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101429.name: True Swing Golf
101429.description:
The game features four separate modes of play: Stroke Play, where the player embarks on any courses unlocked in the game; Match Play, where the player engages in a matchplay against a computer opponent of a chosen difficulty level; Free Round, where the player is free to take on any hole on any particular course he has already unlocked; Championship, where the player progresses through a series of tournaments in order to unlock other courses and progress through the ranks, from a Rookie to a Junior, then Senior and finally Master.

The game also features a Golf Shop which sells golfing equipment (separated into clubsets, golf balls and golf shoes), and, depending on the player's progress in the Championship, restocks its inventories with more advanced equipment until the player has completed the Masters Level Championship.

Despite it being named as a realistic golf game, players could utilise their clubset's skills to power up their shots, deliver more spin to the ball, or curve the ball more, which would decrease a Power Meter that gradually charges up over time as a player advances through the golf course.
