There are a total of fifteen courses to unlock, the last three which are basically extremely windy versions of the first three courses the player would encounter in the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "True Swing Golf", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101430.name: As Time Goes By
101430.description:
Jake Hunter, known in Japan as Tantei Jingūji Saburō (探偵神宮寺三郎?, Detective Saburō Jingūji) is a mystery-adventure game series originally developed by Data East in 1987, and later developed by WorkJam and other companies.

Despite its popularity in Japan, only one of its games have been released overseas: Tantei Jingūji Saburō DS: Inishie no Kioku was retitled and released in North America on June 11, 2008 by Aksys Games as Jake Hunter: Detective Chronicles. The game was rereleased on May 26, 2009 as Jake Hunter Detective Story: Memories of the Past, which contains the original three cases with new translations to improve the original game content, plus three new cases, and a large number of unlockables including comics.

Jake investigates a burglary at a mansion, while Yulia searches for the home of a young boy. Both cases seemed simple, until they become one.

Source: Wikipedia, "Jake Hunter", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101431.name: Ike Ike! Nekketsu Hockey Bu: Subette Koronde Dairantō
101431.description:
ke Ike! Nekketsu Hockey Bu: Subette Koronde Dairantō (いけいけ！熱血ホッケー部「すべってころんで大乱闘」?, Go Go! Nekketsu Hockey Club: "Skate, Fall, Great Free-for-All Brawl") centers around Kunio's attempt to help out his school's hockey club.

The game was planned to be released in North America under the title of Crash 'n the Boys: Ice Challenge, but was canceled. A teaser of the game was featured in Crash 'n the Boys: Street Challenge.

It was released for the Virtual Console in Japan on August 18, 2009.

Source: Wikipedia, "Kunio-kun", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101433.description:
From the box:
Travel with Polly and her friends to explore 18 fun-filled locations in Pollyville. Along the way you'll stop at their favorite places: the Pet Shop, Pizzeria, Zoo, Beach and more.

The adventure starts by collecting three cards to complete a scene. The first player who matches four scenes wins the game!

Gameplay: Each player starts with seven cards. On each turn, a player draws one card, then lays down any matches they have (of 3 cards). If a match is laid down, the player draws three new cards. The player can continue to lay down matches and take 3 new cards until they can make no more matches. To complete the turn, the player discards one card. Cards cannot be picked up from the discard pile, but that pile is reshuffled to become the draw pile if that pile is depleted. First player to complete 4 matches wins the game.
101433.name: Polly Pocket Pollyville Card Game

101434.name: K-Stateopoly

647.name: Late for the Sky Production Company

boardgameversion.104866: Late for the Sky Second Edition

101434.description:
From the box:
Buy campus properties and favorite area businesses as you make your way around the board. Collect credit hours and trade them for diplomas. Academic Probation sends you home...or make the Dean's List and collect a $200 scholarship. Play the traditional version or the 1 hour version.

This Monopoly variant utilizes locations and cards appropriate to the campus of Kansas State University.

101435.name: Paws and Claws: Pet Vet (Windows)
101435.description:
Players assume the role of a veterinarian running a pet clinic and must heal sick pets back to full health. At the beginning of the game, this involves treating smaller pets such as guinea pigs, rabbits, and birds. As the player gains experience, larger animals such as horses, dogs, or cats become available. The clinic's facilities can be expanded and altered (for instance, the style of kennels used to house the animals). Expanding facilities enables more pets to be housed and increases the range of treatments available. Players are also responsible for managing the clinic's finances and supplies.[1]

Each type of pet has a different type of task to be completed in order to heal them. Dogs can play fetch and be taken for a run to increase their fitness and horses can be ridden and taken out to the pasture.

Source: Wikipedia, "Paws and Claws: Pet Vet", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

36775.name: Star Fleet Battles Commanders Rulebook Update I

101436.description:
After releasing Star Fleet Battles Expansion #1, Expansion #2, and Expansion #3 all of the rules were reformatted into the Commander's Rulebook system.

In the new format, all rules were brought together and divided into separate topics. The rulebooks were intended to be separated at the binder and placed loosely in a 3-ring binder. New rules could be inserted, and each update included a new comprehensive table of contents.

Commander's Rulebook #1 included the original basic and advanced rules as well as the new rules and errata from Expansion #1. This rulebook contained the rules and errata from Expansions #2 and #3.

For those who already had the expansions, the rulebooks were sold separately. For those who were new to the game, they were sold in re-packaged box formats Star Fleet Battles Volume I and Star Fleet Battles Volume II, respectively.

Re-implements:

Star Fleet Battles
Star Fleet Battles Designer's Edition
Star Fleet Battles Expansion #2
Star Fleet Battles Expansion #3




Re-implemented-by:

Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition
101436.name: Star Fleet Battles: Commander's Rulebook Volume II

101437.description:
From the back:

CAPTAIN'S LOG #2 features the short story and scenario, REFINER'S FIRE, by James Ashauer. The story details the Romulan attempt to destroy the Gorn Heavy Cruiser Reptilicon as a prelude to an invasion of the Gorn Confederation. The decisive battle occurred at the Gorn/Federation border. The Scenario allows up to four players to recreate this climactic final battle.

The second feature of CAPTAIN'S LOG #2 is "Who's Who in the Star Fleet Universe." A brief background is given on the key people who are involved in the continuing creation of the STAR FLEET BATTLES gaming system.

CAPTAIN'S LOG #2 also includes the new Impulse Movement Charts for 8, 16, and 24 Impulses and three new Command Cruisers: The Gorn Allosaurus Rex, the Hydran Lord Marshal, and the Romulan Superhawk.

Over twenty new scenarios are included in CAPTAIN'S LOG #2. Some scenario titles are: "Mutiny on the Demonslayer," "A Question of Franchise," "Ambush!," and "The Rain of Terror." Also included is the Campaign Game "The Expedition" which allows players to recreate the Hydran attempt to drive through the Klingon Empire.
101437.name: Captain's Log #2

101438.name: Spy Fox: Dry Cereal
101438.description:
SPY Fox™ is SPY Corp's top secret agent. Bad guys don't stand a chance against this clever fox and his stash of cool, high-tech spy gadgets! In Dry Cereal™, the world's dairy cows have been "cow-napped" by a villainous goat, forcing kids to eat their cereal without milk! Team up with SPY Fox to use amazing gadgets like a laser toothbrush and x-ray chewing gum to crack the case! Plus, race spy vehicles through challenging courses to rack up big points and recover the stolen cheese in the FREE activity game – Cheese Chase!

Features
Use tons of cool, high-tech spy gadgets to help SPY Fox crack the case.
Cartoon-quality learning adventure where you choose where the characters go.
Explore exciting locations and collect information to complete the adventure.
The adventure changes each time you play!
Story and teaching level suitable for 7 to 8 year olds.
Hand-drawn pictures and animation.
Dialogues that stimulate vocabulary and the imagination.
An exciting, hilarious adventure to develop your child's detective abilities.
Multiple surprise animations.
Random positioning of clues for hours of gameplay fun.

Source: The Developer Website.

101439.name: Spy Fox 3: Operation Ozone
101439.description:
SPY Fox is a supersmooth secret agent who always looks sharp in his white tuxedo, and always has something witty to say. In this, his latest adventure, he uses an array of special spy gadgets dispensed from Professor Quack's spy gadget vending machine.
Gadgets include the Sticky Stun Bun, a stunner but with more caramel and nuts, and Canned Laughter, which causes an immediate Laugh Riot. The colorful cast includes archvillainess Poodles Galore, an unsatisfied, power-craving cosmetics queen; Trudy Fruit, a dedicated student working towards her Ph.D. in Gumotology; and Bobby Llama the Donut Guru, an ex-baker who has gone to the desert to find the ultimate meaning of the donut hole.
Your "Operation Ozone" Mission: The mischievous "Poodles Galore" is up to no good - this time she's plotting to destroy the Earth's protective ozone layer. Travel around the Earth and even in space, search for clues and collect information from wacky characters. Only YOU and top secret agent Spy Fox can stop Poodles Galore and save the planet! Recommended for children ages 7+.

Features
Take a break from the adventure to play the fun bowling mini-game.
Stock up on cool high-tech spy gadgets at Professor Quack's lab!
Different adventures keep the game exciting.
Play the game directly from the CD - no installation required!
Includes 11 original spy songs.
Games can be saved and finished later.

Source: The Publisher Website.

101440.name: Spy Fox: Cheese Chase
101440.description:
Something sure smells funny... the Limburger Cheese has been kidnapped! Spy Corps operatives have evidence that spy Russian Blue has stolen the prized cheese. SPY Fox is the only agent slick enough to stay on Russian Blue's tail as she speeds away from heisting the prized Limburger.
In this Junior Arcade game, SPY Fox races after Blue and must deal with her henchmen and their weapons while he continues the chase through streets and snow, through air and water. That pretty Blue kitty's goons are in the thick of the chase as Quack provides motorcycles, snowmobiles, jet-skis, ultralights and an assortment of SPY gadgets to help return the cherished cheese. You control the intrepid Fox's movement in this vertical side-scroller as he chases his quarry on SPY scooters, jet-skis, and ultralights.
When the going gets rough, a variety of Spy Gadgets will appear on the path in crates....but so will nasty surprises that Fox will want to dodge around. As with all Humongous titles, no one dies - a pie in the face or the "banana shooter" is about as violent as the action gets. Just be sure to watch out for potholes and streetlight poles!

Features
100 game levels.
Kid Editor allows you to make your own crazy levels.
Helps to develop concentration, hand-eye coordination, decision-making abilities, setting and reaching goals.

Source: The Publisher Website.

101441.name: Spy Fox 2: Some Assembly Required
101441.description:
Spy Fox 2: "Some Assembly Required" is the second of three games in the Spy Fox series of video games developed by Humongous Entertainment and marketed by Atari. The game is an adventure game centered around the World's Fair. The villain in this game is Napoleon LeRoach, the leader of the Society of Meaningless Evil, Larceny, Lying and Yelling (S.M.E.L.L.Y.) tries to disrupt the fair by using an evil Dogbot, a 1000/1 scale robot capable of destroying the fairgrounds.

Introduction
The freedom of the world is once again in peril as the Spy Corps must call on their trusty envoy, Spy Fox to neutralize a plot engineered by the Society of Meaningless Evil, Larceny, Lying and Yelling (S.M.E.L.L.Y.)...

Source: Wikipedia, "Spy Fox 2: "Some Assembly Required"", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101442.name: Spy Fox: Hold the Mustard
101442.description:
SPY Fox in Hold the Mustard is an arcade game in the SPY Fox series. Unlike the other SPY Fox games, this one is a vertical side-scroller where SPY Fox must use his M.E.S.S. (Multiple Environment Spy Ship) to travel through 101 levels over different terrains (water, land, space and air) to save the world's ketchup supply.

Source: The Developer Website.

101443.name: Pajama Sam's Sock Works
101443.description:
As he is getting ready for bed, Sam's mother reminds him to sort his socks before going to school the next day. As he falls asleep, he begins to dream about having a machine to do it for him, with moving belts, chutes, and other strange inventions to move differently colored socks into the similarly-colored baskets (which the game plays through). In this game, Pajama Sam is voiced by E.G. Daily.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pajama Sam", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101444.name: Pajama Sam's Lost and Found
101444.description:
Sam, while trying to find his misplaced belongings, travels through various lands with characters from past adventures, jumping to grab items floating in mid-air and avoid obstacles.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pajama Sam", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101445.name: Pajama Sam: Games to Play on Any Day
101445.description:
User Summary
Pajama Sam is bored on a rainy day, so he decides to play a board game, but his favorite one is on the top shelf. Sam attempts to climb up to reach it, but falls back on a pile of other board games and lands in a strange world where he can play 8 classic games and 2 puzzle games. This is the last Pajama Sam game to have Sam's voice provided by Pamela Segall.

101446.name: Yu-Gi-Oh! The Duelists of the Roses
101446.description:
Back of the Box

A New Yu-Gi-Oh! for a New Generation!

Amidst the dark intrigue of Medieval Europe, the descendants of Yugi and Seto clash again!

Choose your side in the Wars of the Roses and fight to collect all of the magical and powerful Rose Cards.

The ultimate Tactical Card Battling game is here!

101447.name: Fatty Bear's Birthday Surprise
101447.description:
User Summary

In Fatty Bear's Birthday Surprise, the player helps Fatty Bear prepare for his good friend Kaila's birthday party. It is a point-and-click adventure, whereupon the player decorates the cake and the room, prepares Kaila's present, and explores the small home of Fatty Bear before Kaila arrives.

101448.name: His Due
101448.description:
publisher blurb

Imagine if you woke up from a troubling dream somewhere other than in your bed, to see a strangely-coloured animal next to you. And it talked. And it told you that you now had a battery of magical powers that could shake the ground and bring down buildings. Imagine that these powers had come at the cost of something, but the deal you struck with that animal to gain them is excised from your memory so you can't remember what that was. 'His Due' is a game about a hidden war taking place in the world around us, and the reluctant participants who must kill each other if they want to find out how they were drawn into it.

101449.name: Fatty Bear's FunPack
101449.description:
In this single-player product, you play against Fatty Bear 3 board games (Reversi, Lines & Boxes, Tangrams) or the card game Go Fish, most with several difficulty levels. There's also an electronic coloring book with over 30 pages - interesting variation here is that players can mix their own colors and shades, which seemed to work pretty well.

Source: Wikipedia, "Fatty Bear", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101450.name: Putt-Putt's Fun Pack
101450.description:
Putt-Putt Fun Pack is made up of several mini-games featuring Putt-Putt. This includes checkers, puzzle blocks, cheese king (spelling), pinball, memory and tic-tac-toe.

Source: The Developer Website.

101451.name: The Belmont Stakes Handicap Horse Racing Game
101451.description: Handicap Horse Racing is basically a solitaire game which recreates a horse race. It takes the Daily Racing Form Past Performances and shows how to analyze it and fill out a Handicap Form Analysis Sheet. The player then alternates turns between using a spinner for the Analysis Sheet and playing Action Racing Cards. The box states that players will learn to read horse racing performance charts and how to handicap (predict) race results for all types of bets including; Daily Double, Quinella, Exacta and Tri-fecta. A clever and unique approach.

101452.name: Putt-Putt & Fatty Bear's Activity Pack
101452.description:
Putt-Putt and Fatty Bear's Activity Pack combines Putt Putt's Fun Pack and Fatty Bear's Activity Pack into one game with 4 new minigames, totaling at 15 minigames. Each minigame has 4 difficulty levels, easy, medium, hard, and hardest. Some games are traditional, while others are retitled popular games, such as Remember playing the same as Memory. While others are just for creative play like Fatty Bear's Coloring.

Source: The Developer Website.

101453.name: Big Thinkers: First Grade
101453.description:
Big Thinkers First Grade is a game in the Big Thinkers series. Ben and Becky Brightly teach children sixteen lessons. These lessons are comprised of Computation, Addition and Subtraction, Reading: Nouns and Verbs, Fractions, Time Telling, Phonics, Spelling, Environmental Science, Geography & Directions, Life & Physical Sciences, Thinking Skills, Spatial Perception, Art Creativity and Music Creativity.

Source: The Developer Website.

101454.name: Big Thinkers: Kindergarten
101454.description:
Big Thinkers Kindergarten is a game in the Big Thinkers series. Ben and Becky Brightly teach children sixteen lessons. These lessons are comprised of letter identification, measurement and estimation, sequencing and patterning, alphabet skills, reading and sentences, counting, computation, geography and directions, time telling, environmental science, thinking skills, spatial perception, art and music creativity and spelling and phonics.

Source: The Developer Website.

101455.name: Backyard Football

videogamehonor.29639: 2000 D.I.C.E. Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee (Computer)

101455.description:
Backyard Football is a football video game released by Humongous Entertainment in 1999. The game was the third Humongous Sports game released by Humongous Entertainment, preceded by Backyard Soccer and Backyard Baseball. It is the first of all of the Backyard Sports series to consist of the Backyard kids and professional players as kids.

There are 3 types of gameplay available in Backyard football. The first one is a single game. A player picks the field they wish to play on, the weather type (those being sunny, where the players run very fast, rainy, in which the players run at a normal speed and the ball is very hard to throw, and snowy, where players are slow), the level of difficulty between easy, medium, or hard, and decide on whether they want the automatic or manual kick on.

The second type of gameplay is season mode. The player selects their coach name, settings, and team before the season and drafts all seven of their players before the CPU picks any for the rest of the computer controlle teams in the league.

The third type of gameplay is online play. Backyard Football is the only game along with Backyard Baseball 2001 that offers online play with players across the globe. Online play is hosted through the Junior Sports Network, online play that is only available for Windows users, since the network system does not support Macintosh.

Source: Wikipedia, "Backyard Football (1999 video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101456.name: Backyard Football 2002

videogamehonor.29728: 2003 D.I.C.E. Best Family Game of the Year Nominee (Console)

101456.description:
User Summary

Backyard Football 2002 is the second installment in the Backyard Football series by Humongous Entertainment.

It features similar gameplay and reoccurring characters compared with its prequel, incorporating real-world professionals into children's teams as cartoon children.
Players may play alone, against the computer or they may play against others online through the Junior Sports Network. Single games or series games may be played with cumulative statistics being recorded.

101457.name: Backyard Football 2003

videogameversion.105001: North American Game Boy Advance edition

101457.description:
User Summary

Backyard Football 2003 an installment in the Backyard Football series by Humongous Entertainment created specifically for Nintendo's Game Boy Advance and GameCube.

It features similar gameplay and reoccurring characters compared with its prequels, incorporating real-world professionals into children's teams as cartoon children.
Players may play alone, against the computer. Single games or series games may be played with cumulative statistics being recorded.

101458.name: Backyard Football 2004
101458.description:
User Summary

Backyard Football 2004 was only released for PCs running Windows.

It features similar gameplay and reoccurring characters compared with its prequels, incorporating real-world professionals into children's teams as cartoon children. More power-ups and teams have been included in this edition.
Players may play alone, against the computer. Single games or series games may be played with cumulative statistics being recorded.

101460.name: Backyard Football 2006
101460.description:
User Summary

Backyard Football 2006 was made for the Game Boy Advance and for Windows.

It features similar gameplay and reoccurring characters compared with its prequels, incorporating real-world professionals into children's teams as cartoon children. More power-ups and teams have been included in this edition.
Players may play alone, against the computer. Single games or series games may be played with cumulative statistics being recorded.

101461.name: Backyard Sports: Football 2007

videogameversion.105007: North American Game Boy Advance edition

101461.description:
User Summary

Backyard Football 2007 was only released for the Game Boy Advance.

It features similar gameplay and reoccurring characters compared with its prequels, incorporating real-world professionals into children's teams as cartoon children. More power-ups and teams have been included in this edition.
Players may play alone, against the computer. Single games or series games may be played with cumulative statistics being recorded.

101462.name: Backyard Sports: Rookie Rush
101462.description:
It’s time for kick off! Team up with the coolest and craziest kids ever to play football. Choose from a variety of playing options – including a super-charged Story Mode, or kick into Multi-player Mode to play pick up games with your friends and family.

Pick Up: A single, exhibition-style matchup for up to four players, At most 2 per team. Users will get to choose their teams and venue

Story: Build the ultimate Backyard Dream Team to become a gaming star and appear on the box of the new Backyard Sports Video game.

Season: Build the ultimate Backyard Dream Team to become a gaming star and appear on the box of the new Backyard Sports Video game.

Tournament: A selection of preset tournaments plus the option to create your own custom tournament.

Mini-Games: A selection of skill-based mini-games for up to four players.

Extras: Where users can go to find player bios, records they’ve set, Awards they have earned, view the games credits and set various game options.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgamehonor.21259: 2012 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "6 years and up" Nominee

101463.description:
In Paletto, players in compliance of some easy rules remove stones in different colours from a 6x6 square grid board. There are 6 pieces of each of 6 color. All 36 playing pieces are placed on the gameboard such that same-colored pieces do not touch horizontally or vertically. This is a Latin square design.

The game is won by the player who either takes all 6 pieces of any color or whoever takes the last piece from the board.

By turn, the players remove stones. Only stones with at least two vacant sides can be removed, and all remaining stones must still be orthogonally connected.

Paletto is a derivative of Keks by the same designer.
101463.name: Paletto

101465.name: Army of Ages
101465.description:
User Summary

In Army of Ages our world is invaded by aliens. While in the Stone Age, you'll build clubbers, sling men and pre-historical dragonlike creatures to battle the different types of aliens creatures which crawl, walk and fly to your base. Once you gain enough experience points, you can upgrade to the next era: Medieval, Renaissance and so on and so forth.

View is 2D with your base to the far left and the enemy base to the far right. Units just walk on until fighting distance, where they will fight until dead. Units are automatically built after the correct building has been placed (like: sling men tent) and the player then mostly has to concentrate on (re)building turrets and unit spell like effects, like meteorite (Stone Age and further), Rain Hail (Medieval and further) etc.

101466.name: Arcanis Fast Play

rpgsetting.3957: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires

101466.description:
From the back of the book:

A World of Heroes...

With the power held in these pages, one will forge a Hero, a veteran of dangerous adventures, a capable and courageous champion of Arcanis. There are many such Heroes - be they brave knights, pious priests, cunning rakes or mysterious sorcerers - but Fate has only a chosen few destined to shape the world with their passing. Your Hero is among them.

...in Search of Legends

This tome is your gateway into epic tales limited only by your mettle and imagination. With it, you will create the greatest Heroes Arcanis has ever seen and test them in the crucible of dangerous times. Within its pages, you will discover:

• An introduction to the Origins-Award winning World of Arcanis to greet our newest Heroes
• An accounting of that which has gone before, to welcome the return of our seasoned veterans
• Complete rules for the creation and advancement of great Heroes, ready to set out and forge the future
• A new combat and skill system to test the wits and mettle of even the most jaded Hero
• A magic system that places the very power of creation in your hands, at peril to your mortal form

101467.name: Backyard Baseball (iOS)
101467.description:
User Summary

Backyard Baseball is another rendition of the Backyard Baseball series except that it has been modified for the iPhone and the iPad.
Gameplay is relatively simplistic with a well-timed tap determining the horizontal angle of the ball which is aimed at, not the field of an opposing team, but at a series of wooden targets that determine the type of run the batter is entitled to.

101468.name: Backyard Soccer (iOS)
101468.description:
User Summary

Backyard Soccer is the iOS edition of the computer game Backyard Soccer. It is available for both the iPhone and the iPad as downloadable content.
Game-play has been simplified for play with a touchscreen, though the art and theme remains consistent. The player can kick the ball using any of the three forward players provided and attempt deflecting it around the opposing defensive characters. Rather than simulating an entire soccer game, corner kicks are the extent of game-play.

101469.name: Boss Battle
101469.description:
User Summary

In this bullet hell like game you steer a small triangle (or: spaceship, with lots of fantasy) shooting at a large cube like object. Meanwhile, solid circles fly randomly around, killing you in collision. You can collect items which give you more bullets, wider fields of fire, rockets, etc.

This black and white abstract shooter has the look&feel of the first shooter games when the platforms/ arcade machines were still monochrome and gameplay mechanics were as simple as can be.

101470.name: Backyard Soccer 2004
101470.description:
Box Back

It's time to head out to the field for another round of soccer action with the backyard kids and real pro players as kids. In this year's Backyard Soccer, you can build the championship soccer team of your dreams. It's up to you to pick your team, set the positions, and direct the action. Choose from Major League Soccer teams or customize your own Backyard team. During each match, you have the chance to earn new offensive and defensive power-ups.

Features

Play soccer with the pros as kids, including Landon Donovan and Cobi Jones
Choose from all 10 Major League Soccer teams
Play quick games, single games, or a whole season
Includes 4 new fields
Track player and team stats

101471.name: Backyard Soccer: Major League Soccer Edition
101471.description:
User Summary

In this Major League edition, Backyard Soccer introduces Major League Soccer players in their child, cartoon form. Players create their own soccer player avatar which can then play on the same teams as the up-and-coming Major League players as well as players from the Women's US Olympic team of the 2000 Olympics.

101472.name: Backyard Hockey
101472.description:
Box Back

Hit the ice and play Hockey like pro! Backyard Hockey is nonstop 3-on-3 action with realistic NHL plays and crazy arcade power moves. Play all 30 NHL teams, 10 wacky Backyard teams, or create your own. The best selling kids’ hockey video game of all time, Backyard Hockey comes loaded with top NHL Superstars as kids: Nicklas Lidstrom, Sidney Crosby, Mike Modano and more. And with the DS controls, you can call your plays and direct the on-ice action by touch or with the regular control pad. Play one game or a whole season. Tons of unlockable players, fields, and surprises.

Game highlights:

NHL and NHL Players Association licenses
All current 30 NHL Teams, Uniforms, & Logos
Updated roster of NHL athletes as kids: Lidstrom, Crosby, Modano, Thornton, Sakic, Jagr, and more
New NHL plays and strategies
Season play and single pick up game modes
10 New rinks and environments
New intuitive touch-screen controls
New wireless DS multi-card play
Three levels of difficulty
New power ups, mini games, & surprises

101473.name: What Did I Do To Deserve This, My Lord!? 2

videogameseries.42183: What Did I Do To Deserve This My Lord!?

101473.description:
What Did I Do To Deserve This My Lord!? 2 (formerly known as Holy Invasion Of Privacy, Badman! 2: Time To Tighten Up Security!, known as Yūsha no Kuse ni Namaiki da or2, 勇者のくせになまいきだor2, literally "For a hero, [you are] quite impudent/cheeky/bold] or2)" in Japan) is a real-time strategy/god game for the PlayStation Portable, sequel to What Did I Do To Deserve This, My Lord?. Its concept is the same as the first game's: creating mazes and monsters to defend Overlord Badman, a demon lord, from the heroes who try to slay him.

The gameplay is the same as the first Holy Invasion Of Privacy, Badman! game's: Using a limited number of "steps" and a pickaxe, the player must dig and create a maze with monsters in it, to defend Overlord Badman from the heroes.

A trailer announcing the game's North American release claims Holy Invasion Of Privacy, Badman! 2 contains "4 times more stages, 3.3 times more monsters and 2.3 times more heroes" than the first game.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/What_Did_I_Do_To_Deserve_This,_...; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101474.name: Backyard Hockey 2005
101474.description:
Box Back

The Backyard Kids hit the ice for the "coolest" Backyard game ever! With a new lineup of NHL kids and amazing 3D gameplay, Backyard Hockey will satisfy any young rink rat. Kids can draft their own NHL teams, pick a favorite rink, and control every quick move and scorching slapshot! Outrageous power-ups, new street hockey rinks, and exciting end-to-end action will keep kids playing hard and laughing out loud... on their way to the Backyard Hockey League Championship!

101475.name: Hazmat
101475.description:
User Summary

In Hazmat you operate some small pinkish, alien looking creature. Steering is using the arrow keys. You can double-jump by pressing 'up' twice. And steer while in flight. View is 2D, you'll have to jump from one platform to the other to reach the exit door of the level, evading toxic pools and such. Graphics are pretty basic and resemble the old arcade games like on C-64 and ZX Spectrum.

101476.name: Neon 2.5
101476.description:
Neon 2.5 is a bit of a spin off from the regular neon platform, this time you are in charge of the neon base and must shoot off the hordes of enemies and protecting your base from enemy fire.
This is a fast paced shooter game shooting your way through from wave to wave, there are no life power ups so you must preserve your base power to get as far through the waves as possible.

Source: The Developer Website.

User Summary
In this game you steer a triangle (spaceship?) by moving your mouse. Shooting is strictly limited to where you move. Object enter your screen and collision is deadly. Several are homing in on your position, meaning you both want to fly away from then and want to point your nose to them to shoot. Split second choices. The game resembles the old arcade classics, but with smoother (though abstract) graphics.

101478.name: Rainbow Blitz
101478.description:
Description:
Rainbow blitz is a simple but addictive coffee break game that keeps you coming back for more. Rainbow town is under attack and it’s up to you to protect it with your two cannons. Create explosions that will destroy the bombs before they hit the town, and cause huge chain reactions to rack up the points and get a high score.

Single Player
High score compatible

Awards:
Newgrounds.com - front page 28/08/2007

Source: The Developer Website.

101479.name: Spitwad
101479.description:
Description:
Spitwad is a great coffee break game for one or two players. Take control of a rebellious school boy and play against the computer for a top score, or against a friend just for fun. Take it in turns to fire spit wads at each other until there is a winner. The player with the most wins out of three rounds is declared the champion!
High scores compatible.
One or two players.

Source: The Developer Website.

101480.name: Abstract Sea
101480.description:
Description:
Abstract sea is the first of what we hope will be a trilogy of different shoot 'em ups (shmups) done in this abstract style. This is a sort of tribute to those of you who liked the neon games, but wished they were keyboard controlled.
You control a lone gun boat in a battle against the enemy naval force, you must survive as long as you can while trying to rack up a massive score by making huge kill combos and collecting all the bonus points dropped by enemy ships.
This is a game very much based on style and music, we hope you enjoy it!

Awards
Newgrounds.com - More than 25k views
Newgrounds.com - Daily 3rd Place - 02/27/2007

Source: The Developer Website.

101481.name: Puchi Puchi Virus
101481.description:
In the game,a planet much like Earth has been affected by a horrible viral outbreak. Anybody infected turns into a weird monster with a pun for a name,such as the Flying Panduh, a panda with a jetpack, a frying pan and an aversion to country music. As the outbreak worsens, Dr. Kevin and his two assistants decide to take a stand against the disease using their newly invented vaccine, made by pure awesome.

The game challenges players to link geometric viruses together to erase them before they turn into stones. Links are created by linking three viruses together into a triangle; and then 'popping' this triangle to remove the viruses. Combos can be created by overlapping two triangles and then popping the first triangle created. There are 102 levels within the game, each having a different objective (a certain score, a certain number of combos etc within a varying time limit).

Source: Wikipedia, Puchi Puchi Virus, available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101482.name: The Pumpkin Run
101482.description:
The Pumpkin Run is just a little seasonal game we made to get everyone in the holiday spirit for halloween. The idea is to collect all the candy before the bats can take it away.

Source: The Developer Website.

101484.name: Pixel Monsters
101484.description:
Description:
Pixel Monsters is a turn based battle game where the player must first design a monster which they will then use to battle against a series of computer controlled bosses. Using a combination of trumps like gameplay and a stategical rpg battle system, the player must defeat their opponent in order to raise their stats and proceed to the next round. After each round, the player must decide if they want to continue to the next challange and risk losing their score, or save their hi-score on the online scoreboard and show the world that they have the monst powerfull monster!

Awards:

Newgrounds.com - Frontpage
Newgrounds.com - Over 100k Views




Source: The Developer Website.

101485.name: Viroidz
101485.description:
Description:
viroids is a fast paced top down shooter with non stop action. Based in a petri dish, the player must take control of a micro ship and blast enemy microbes to bits. With 35 levels of virus blasting and over 6 crazy powerups, viroidz will keep you playing for a long time.

Awards:

Newgrounds.com - Daily 4th Place - 01/26/2007




Source: The Developer Website.

101486.name: Lumination
101486.description:
Description:
Lumination is a fast paced action arcade game where the player must please a crowd at a fireworks display! The player must click the fireworks that correspond with the colour of the cursor in order to gain points. The more of each colour they click before the cursor changes, the more points they get. A great game for any time.

Awards:

Newgrounds.com - Daily Fifth Place




Source: The Developer Website.

101487.name: SoulCalibur: Broken Destiny

videogamehonor.31884: 2009 Game Critics Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee

101487.description:
User Summary:

This game is a continuation of the SoulCalibur series as it is brought over to a handheld gaming device. It remains true to the original concept of the series. The game is still a 3D fighting game, in which two combatants battle one another in large, open arenas. This edition is very similar to SoulCalibur IV, although it removes the Star Wars characters while adding in Kratos from God of War.

This game features 29 different playable characters. There are five different modes from which the player can choose: Quick Match (drops the player right into a fight), Trials Mode (which pits the player against opponents one after the other until the player is defeated), Versus (ad hoc battle between two players over wireless connection), Training (which allows the player to practice moves against an immobile opponent), and Gauntlet (this main "story" mode of the game ). The game also features the ability to customize existing characters, or to create your own.

The Gauntlet mode of the game is the longest portion. It is based on a non-canonical SoulCalibur story in which the player's chosen character follows Hilde around the world in search of medicine for her ailing father. Each encounter in this mode is mission-based and the player must discover the criteria that will allow them to be successful.

101488.description: This expansion for Lerne München kennen contains 300 new trivia cards on the city of München.
101488.name: Lerne München kennen: 300 neue Fragen

101489.name: Checkers
101489.description:
User Summary

Basic game of checkers for Atari 2600

101490.name: Worldwide Soccer - Sega International Victory Goal Edition
101490.description:
Sega Worldwide Soccer, produced by Sega themselves was one of the killer apps in the peak of popularity for the console. It was preceded by Victory Goal, an already ageing football game (one of the debut titles of the console). The game featured international teams and league, play-off and tournament modes. Although it used fictional player names (due to the lack of a license), the non-volatile memory of the Saturn allowed editing of names. The team kits were as close to the official 1996 kits as possible. The gameplay was also highly praised, and was the top-rated football game until ISS 64 was released one year later. Worldwide soccer was later ported to the PC.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sega Worldwide Soccer", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101491.name: Arnold Palmer Tournament Golf
101491.description:
It was known as Naomichi Ozaki no Super Masters (尾崎直道のスーパーマスターズ?, possibly "Osaki Naomichi's Super Masters") in Japan. It is one of the early Sega sports games where a celebrity athlete's name was added to the title when it was localized from Japan (the other two games being Tommy Lasorda Baseball and Pat Riley Basketball). Although Arnold Palmer is shown on the box cover and at the title screen, the game makes no reference to him during the actual golf game play. The game features music composed by Bo.

Source: Wikipedia, "Arnold Palmer Tournament Golf", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101492.name: Sports Talk Baseball
101492.description:
ports Talk Baseball (released in Japan as Pro Yakyuu Super League '91) is a Mega Drive/Genesis baseball video game which features an official MLBPA license as well as most rules and aspects followed by Major League Baseball.

Unlike real professional baseball however, the game ends when one team has 10 or more runs than the other team (win by domination, or "mercy" rule). Players can play either exhibition, regular season, all-star, or playoff games. The game also features authentic Major League Baseball rosters for the 1991 season. Gameplay commonly features double and triple plays, and only the fastest runners in the game are capable of stealing bases. It was one of the first video games to feature individual hitting abilities for each pitcher.

Classic match-ups include Texas' Nolan Ryan versus Oakland's lineup with such all-stars as Jose Canseco, Rickey Henderson, Dave Henderson, and Mark McGwire.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sports Talk Baseball", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101493.name: NFL '95
101493.description:
NFL '95 is the sixth game in the Joe Montana Football series. It is similar to the previous, NFL Football '94 Starring Joe Montana, except in this version, there is no play by play commentary, the lineups of the football teams are updated to reflect the 1994 NFL season, and there are more plays for the player's football team to perform on offense and defense. Once again, Joe Montana appears on the title screen.

Source: Wikipedia, "NFL '95", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101494.name: American McGee's Grimm: Episode 14 – Iron John
101494.description:
When a young, disobedient prince recklessly puts several lives in danger by releasing a sadistic, metal monster of a man named Iron John (for the sake of a toy) and gets rewarded, Grimm decides it's time this story got set to "Terminator" mode! Follow Iron John and Prince Connor as they journey through the local town, Iron John's pond hideout, Prince Connor's massive castle abode, Iron John's "Midas pool", a kingdom that neighbors Prince Connor's, the old king's tournament, and Prince Connor's wedding. Side with Iron John if you want to live!

Source: Wikipedia, "American McGee's Grimm", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101495.name: American McGee's Grimm: Episode 15 – The Pied Piper
101495.description:
When the town of Hamelin is saved by a mysterious Piper, but the townspeople don't thank him and he doesn't do much as revenge towards them, Grimm decides to crank the plague up a notch or two! Join the Pied Piper as he wanders through the outskirts of Hamelin, Hamelin's town square, the local docks, the riverfront, the Family Celebration Day festival, and the Piper's mountain hideout. Better pay the Piper; you've put up quite a bill!

Source: Wikipedia, "American McGee's Grimm", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101496.name: American McGee's Grimm: Episode 16 – A Christmas Carol
101496.description:
In this special season finale, we wrap up the season with a twist on a holiday classic. If you thought Ebenezer Scrooge was bad, wait till you see what Grimm does with the story!

Source: Wikipedia, "American McGee's Grimm", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101498.name: PGA Tour Golf
101498.description:
PGA Tour is the collective name of a series of golf video games published by Electronic Arts and later their EA Sports sub-label from 1990 to 1998, when EA began publishing their golf games with the endorsement of Tiger Woods. After Tiger Woods '99 was released, subsequent titles were named Tiger Woods PGA Tour and released yearly.
The series were responsible for several innovations in the genre, such as the now standard three-click swing method, but unlike other games in the EA Sports label, the series were often shadowed by other competitors such as the Jack Nicklaus series, Links, Microsoft Golf or The Golf Pro.

Source: Wikipedia, "PGA Tour Golf", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

101499.name: Disgaea 2: Dark Hero Days
101499.description:
User Summary

Disgaea 2: Dark Hero Days is a re-release of Disgaea 2: Cursed Memories for the PSP, with additional content.
All of the original content is still here along with extra scenarios, and characters and mechanics from Disgaea 3: Absence of Justice.

Microbadges available

101500.name: Arcane Heroes
101500.description:
Subtitle: A rules-light roleplaying game of Swashbuckling Action and Ancient Magic

Publisher's description: Arcane Heroes is a rules-light roleplaying game set into a fantasy world filled with magic, wonders and epic adventures.

Characters in Arcane Heroes are members of ancient bloodlines which have produced many great heroes (and dreadful villains) in the past. But the world has changed, the industrial revolution has shaken up the old order. The ancient bloodlines are all but forgotten, but in these dire and gloomy times, heroes are needed more than ever.

Arcane Heroes uses a simple dice pool mechanic and contains all the rules needed to play a game.
